summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned in the description
summary.otherNotes: Currently, a2a-java project tests are run for PRs, but a2a-tck tests are not. The issue aims to add a2a-tck runs to CI for PRs. To run the TCK, the Java system under test needs to be started in the 'a2a-java/tck' directory and then run using the instructions from its README.

issueDTO.title: Exporterhelper truncating logs when prometheus remote writer fails writing metrics
issueDTO.description:
### Component(s)

exporter/prometheus, exporter/prometheusremotewrite

### What happened?

## Description

When `prometheusremotewriter` fails to write metrics, logs from `exporterhelper` are truncated. This is making difficult debugging failure cases because the logs are truncated right before the metric name gets shown.

## Steps to Reproduce

Sending out-of-order metrics to Prometheus seems to always result in a truncated log.

## Expected Result

Error log from `exporterhelper` should be complete like so:

`error	exporterhelper/queued_retry.go:391	Exporting failed. The error is not retryable. Dropping data.	{"kind": "exporter", "data_type": "metrics", "name": "prometheusremotewrite", "error": "Permanent error: Permanent error: remote write returned HTTP status 400 Bad Request; err = %!w(<nil>): maxFailure (quorum) on a given error family, addr=10.1.REDACTED.REDACTED:9095 state=ACTIVE zone=us-east-2b, rpc error: code = Code(400) desc = user=REDACTED: err: out of order sample. timestamp=2025-04-10T19:39:34.739Z, series={__name__=\"target_info\", http_scheme=\"http\", instance=\"localhost:8888\", job=\"otel-collector\", net_host_port=\"8888\"}\n", "dropped_items": 27}`

## Actual Result

What we get is a truncated JSON.

`error	exporterhelper/queued_retry.go:391	Exporting failed. The error is not retryable. Dropping data.	{"kind": "exporter", "data_type": "metrics", "name": "prometheusremotewrite", "error": "Permanent error: Permanent error: remote write returned HTTP status 400 Bad Request; err = %!w(<nil>): maxFailure (quorum) on a given error family, addr=10.1.REDACTED.REDACTED:9095 state=ACTIVE zone=us-east-2b, rpc error: code = Code(400) desc = user=REDACTED: err: out of order sample. timestamp=2025-04-10T19:39:34.739Z, se", "dropped_items": 27}`

### Collector version

v0.123.0, v0.82.0

### Environment information

## Environment
OS: "Amazon Linux 2023"
AWS AMI: amazon-eks-node-1.32-v20250403




### OpenTelemetry Collector configuration

```yaml
receivers:
  otlp:
    protocols:
      grpc: {}
  prometheus:
    config:
      scrape_configs:
        - job_name: opa
          scrape_interval: 30s
          static_configs:
            - targets:
                - localhost:8181
              labels:
                origin: opa
          metric_relabel_configs:
            - source_labels:
                - __name__
              regex: ^http_request_duration_seconds.*
              action: drop
        - job_name: otel-collector
          scrape_interval: 30s
          static_configs:
            - targets:
                - localhost:8888
exporters:
  prometheusremotewrite:
    endpoint: https://aps-workspaces.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/workspaces/<workspace-id>/api/v1/remote_write
    auth:
      authenticator: sigv4auth
    remote_write_queue:
      enabled: true
      queue_size: 100
      num_consumers: 1
    resource_to_telemetry_conversion:
      enabled: true
extensions:
  health_check: {}
  sigv4auth:
    region: us-east-2
processors:
  batch:
    send_batch_max_size: 10000
    timeout: 0s
    send_batch_size: 70
  memory_limiter:
    check_interval: 1s
    limit_percentage: 90
    spike_limit_percentage: 35
  metricstransform:
    transforms:
      - match_type: regexp
        experimental_match_labels:
          origin: opa
        include: ^(opa_)*(.*)
        action: update
        new_name: opa_$${2}
  attributes/insert:
    actions:
      - key: app_name
        value: <APP_NAME>
        action: insert
      - key: k8s_pod_name
        value: ${env:HOSTNAME}
        action: insert
service:
  extensions:
    - health_check
    - sigv4auth
  pipelines:
    metrics:
      receivers:
        - otlp
        - prometheus
      processors:
        - attributes/insert
        - batch
        - memory_limiter
        - metricstransform
      exporters:
        - prometheusremotewrite
```

### Log output

```shell
go.opentelemetry.io/collector/exporter/exporterhelper.(*retrySender).send
	go.opentelemetry.io/collector/exporter@v0.82.0/exporterhelper/queued_retry.go:391
go.opentelemetry.io/collector/exporter/exporterhelper.(*metricsSenderWithObservability).send
	go.opentelemetry.io/collector/exporter@v0.82.0/exporterhelper/metrics.go:125
go.opentelemetry.io/collector/exporter/exporterhelper.(*queuedRetrySender).start.func1
	go.opentelemetry.io/collector/exporter@v0.82.0/exporterhelper/queued_retry.go:195
go.opentelemetry.io/collector/exporter/exporterhelper/internal.(*boundedMemoryQueue).StartConsumers.func1
	go.opentelemetry.io/collector/exporter@v0.82.0/exporterhelper/internal/bounded_memory_queue.go:47
2025-04-10T19:39:35.122Z	error	exporterhelper/queued_retry.go:391	Exporting failed. The error is not retryable. Dropping data.	{"kind": "exporter", "data_type": "metrics", "name": "prometheusremotewrite", "error": "Permanent error: Permanent error: remote write returned HTTP status 400 Bad Request; err = %!w(<nil>): maxFailure (quorum) on a given error family, addr=10.1.REDACTED.REDACTED:9095 state=ACTIVE zone=us-east-2b, rpc error: code = Code(400) desc = user=REDACTED: err: out of order sample. timestamp=2025-04-10T19:39:34.739Z, se", "dropped_items": 27}
```

### Additional context

- `otel/opentelemetry-collector-contrib:0.123.0-arm64` image is mirrored internally to ECR.
- Prometheus instance is AWS AMP.
- Collector is running as a application sidecar on a EKS cluster.
comments:
Pinging code owners:
- exporter/prometheus: @Aneurysm9 @dashpole @ArthurSens
- exporter/prometheusremotewrite: @Aneurysm9 @rapphil @dashpole @ArthurSens

 See [Adding Labels via Comments](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#adding-labels-via-comments) if you do not have permissions to add labels yourself.

It seems the exporter is intentionally limiting the response body to 256 bytes here: https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/blob/f3acb5e455ca9be51ef47228e2da44446b92c569/exporter/prometheusremotewriteexporter/exporter.go#L437-L438

I imagine it's limited to avoid blowing up memory. Perhaps it should be configurable, or at least a little less conservative.

>I imagine it's limited to avoid blowing up memory. 

That makes sense, but as you said it would be nice to have a config for this. We currently have no way of figuring out which metric is causing the error because the exporter log gets truncated and AWS AMP does not provide useful logs.

I'm not sure that making the limit configurable is the right move as it's too specific and would open the door for lots of little knobs in the config that make it harder to maintain and understand.  Instead, I'd suggest removing the body fragment from the error message and emitting it via the logger at the `Debug` level along with increasing its size to 1KB.  

Ultimately, this isn't the right place for this information to be logged and it, technically speaking, shouldn't even be in the response and the response must be ignored, per [the spec](https://prometheus.io/docs/specs/prw/remote_write_spec/#protocol):

> The response body from the remote write receiver SHOULD be empty; clients MUST ignore the response body. The response body is RESERVED for future use.

I've reached out to the AMP service team about ensuring this information is available via vended logs.  If you're able I'd suggest working with your TAM to influence a PFR for this feature as well.
/label -bug good-first-issue -waiting-for-code-owners -exporter/prometheus

repository.description: Contrib repository for the OpenTelemetry Collector
repository.name: opentelemetry-collector-contrib

summary.main: When prometheusremotewriter fails to write metrics, logs from exporterhelper are truncated, making it difficult to debug failure cases.
summary.validationOrRequirement:
Error log from exporterhelper should be complete like so: error exporterhelper/queued_retry.go:391 Exporting failed. The error is not retryable. Dropping data. {'kind': 'exporter', 'data_type': 'metrics', 'name': 'prometheusremotewrite', 'error': 'Permanent error: Permanent error: remote write returned HTTP status 400 Bad Request; err = %!w(<nil>): maxFailure (quorum) on a given error family, addr=10.1.REDACTED.REDACTED:9095 state=ACTIVE zone=us-east-2b, rpc error: code = Code(400) desc = user=REDACTED: err: out of order sample. timestamp=2025-04-10T19:39:34.739Z, series={'__name__': 'target_info', 'http_scheme': 'http', 'instance': 'localhost:8888', 'job': 'otel-collector', 'net_host_port': '8888'}
', 'dropped_items': 27}
summary.attemptedFixes: Code owners are pinged, and a suggestion is made to remove the body fragment from the error message and emit it via the logger at the Debug level along with increasing its size to 1KB. It's also suggested to work with the TAM to influence a PFR for this feature.
summary.otherNotes: The exporterhelper truncates logs when prometheus remote writer fails writing metrics, making it difficult to debug failure cases. The issue is specific to sending out-of-order metrics to Prometheus. Collector version is v0.123.0 and v0.82.0. Environment information includes Amazon Linux 2023, AWS AMI, and OpenTelemetry Collector configuration. Log output shows truncated logs with error messages. Additional context includes internal mirroring of the otel/opentelemetry-collector-contrib:0.123.0-arm64 image, Prometheus instance is AWS AMP, and Collector is running as a sidecar on EKS cluster.

issueDTO.title: [DAG] SDPatternMatch m_Zero/m_One/m_AllOnes have inconsistent undef handling
issueDTO.description:
m_Zero/m_One uses ISD::isConstantSplatVector which allows undefs in the BUILD_VECTOR node by default
m_AllOnes uses isAllOnesOrAllOnesSplat which doesn't allow undefs in the BUILD_VECTOR node by default

All of these need to be consistent with their default and with/without undefs handling to be configurable

This needs to be handled in conjunction with #140745 which will revise m_Zero handling to be closed to m_AllOnes
comments:
Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor is working on this issue. If someone is assigned to the issue or claimed to be working on it, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. Leave a comment indicating that you are working on the issue, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.


@llvm/issue-subscribers-good-first-issue

Author: Simon Pilgrim (RKSimon)

<details>
m_Zero/m_One uses ISD::isConstantSplatVector which allows undefs in the BUILD_VECTOR node by default
m_AllOnes uses isAllOnesOrAllOnesSplat which doesn't allow undefs in the BUILD_VECTOR node by default

All of these need to be consistent with their default and with/without undefs handling to be configurable

This needs to be handled in conjunction with #<!-- -->140745 which will revise m_Zero handling to be closed to m_AllOnes 
</details>

@shrimpnaur, please refer to the assignees section of an issue to see whether it has been assigned to someone. Please share with us your proposed solution to the issue, then I can assign it to you.

Hi @adhiamboperes,
Could you please clarify the current behavior of the animation on the Continue button? Specifically:

-     When is the animation usually shown?

-     When is it expected to not shown?

These two failing tests, are trying to verify that no animation is shown. But, when I run through app UI, the animation is currently being shown.

1. testConIntAnim_openFractions_expId1_checkButtonDoesNotAnimate
2. testContNavBtnAnim_openMathExp_playThroughSecondState_checkContBtnDoesNotAnimateAfter45Sec

Describe the bug
The Continue navigation button shows an animation on the 2nd and 3rd states, which is unexpected.

To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

- Go to the first Test Topic.
- Play the Prototype Exploration.
- Observe the Continue button on the first state and click it.
- On the second state, submit the correct answer. Wait for 45 seconds and observe the Continue button animation. Click Continue.
-  On the third state, submit the correct answer. Wait for 45 seconds and observe the Continue button animation. Click Continue.

Expected Behavior
The Continue button animation should only appear in the first state.

Demonstration
If applicable, add screenshots or videos to help explain the issue.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3dd7feef-662c-4e6a-afee-26e59f624038

Environment
Device: Oppo Reno 2F

Additional Context
Relevant files to investigate:

- StateDeck
- ExplorationProgressController's moveToNextStateImpl()
- ContinueButtonView.kt

- [x] `VK_KHR_pipeline_binary` (#944)
- [x] `VK_EXT_device_generated_commands` (#946)
- [x] `VK_EXT_depth_clamp_control` (#947)
- [ ] `VK_NV_cooperative_matrix2`
- [ ] `VK_KHR_map_memory2`

If an extensions that you need is not exposed in `ash` leave a comment, and I will add it to the list. 

If you would like to implement some extensions but you don't how, have a look at the currently exposed [extensions](https://github.com/MaikKlein/ash/tree/master/ash/src/extensions). Otherwise don't hesitate to ask, help is always appreciated.
comments: Would it make sense to also add some 'hidden' extensions (ie `VK_AMD_gpa_interface` or `VK_AMD_wave_limits`), which are not really specified at this point?

@msiglreith I am fine with experimental extensions. They would have to live inside the extension itself because vk.rs is generated.

I think we should create a new module `extensions::experimental::amd::Foo`. Semver is then ignored for those extensions.
Sounds good! I will try to collect all the necessary information to define the API as I want to play a bit with the `gpa_interface` extension
I've been working on the VK_NV_ray_tracing support now, and likely also VK_EXT_descriptor_indexing

@MaikKlein There's a useful new extension I'd love to see: [VK_KHR_timeline_semaphore][1]

[1]: https://www.khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/1.1-extensions/html/vkspec.html#VK_KHR_timeline_semaphore

(I know you know about this already, just posting for the record).

For MoltenVK use on Mac/iOS, the following extension is quite important:

https://github.com/KhronosGroup/MoltenVK/blob/4e0abab7dbf16b2d64a7e54a43e07327bd40e1d5/MoltenVK/MoltenVK/API/vk_mvk_moltenvk.h

It's unofficial but rather essential since it allows querying for some quirks that are not exposed through the Vulkan API features, such as the inability to combine layered rendering with MSAA.

Khronos released [VK_KHR_synchronization2](https://www.khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/1.1-extensions/html/vkspec.html#VK_KHR_synchronization2) extension recently to simplify the interface and improve usability of these API.
`VK_KHR_dynamic_rendering` please. :)
@K0bin The raw API can be found in https://github.com/MaikKlein/ash/pull/477 (we should merge that ASAP), safe wrapper is in the works.
Great to hear you are already on it.
Theres already support for `VK_KHR_external_memory_fd`, can we get `VK_KHR_external_memory_win32` /  `VK_KHR_external_semaphore_win32` / `VK_KHR_win32_keyed_mutex`?

@chyyran #579 #581. `VK_KHR_win32_keyed_mutex` doesn't have any methods and as such doesn't need a manual extension implementation, perhaps you're looking for `VK_KHR_external_fence_win32` to complement `VK_KHR_external_fence_fd`?
#582 for `VK_KHR_external_fence_win32` :)
Thanks, this will be really useful.

I'll make a release with all these soon, when the Vulkan 1.3 addition is in. Just needs some minor trivial review (the new function wrappers were already approved as extensions, I merely copy-pasted them).
I would be very interested in `VK_NV_framebuffer_mixed_samples`, `VK_NV_coverage_reduction_mode` and `VK_EXT_sample_locations` to play around with some new anti-aliasing techniques :D

@coffeenotfound Fortunately `VK_NV_framebuffer_mixed_samples` doesn't have any functions hence doesn't need any additional support in ash, the extra structs/constants are already available. The other two extensions provide trivial functions that are easy to add.

Hello!
The post-vulkan1.0 functions in the SwapchainKHR extension are loaded into KhrSwapchainFn but don't have an interface through the extensions::khr::Swapchain extension struct.

If it is just a matter of writing by hand functions in the Swapchain structure, I could do it and PR that. I'm just not sure if there's anything related to the autogen to change as well.

@QuartzIsCheap Thanks for bringing this to our attention: these extensions are now available in #629. I'll also see about providing a wrapper for `VK_KHR_device_group` which also makes these functions available.
VK_KHR_external_memory_capabilities is missing.
[VK_EXT_acquire_drm_display](https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_EXT_acquire_drm_display.html) is missing.

[VK_EXT_extended_dynamic_state3](https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_EXT_extended_dynamic_state.html) would be nice to have! 
[Sascha Willems example of usage](https://github.com/SaschaWillems/Vulkan/blob/master/examples/dynamicstate/dynamicstate.cpp)

@wrightwriter Definitely ~, and with this extension promoted to 1.3 we already have the implementation for most of those functions, making a helper fairly straightforward to copy-paste together :grimacing:~

EDIT: Whoops! It was only `VK_EXT_extended_dynamic_state` and `VK_EXT_extended_dynamic_state2`, `VK_EXT_extended_dynamic_state3` was only introduced ~2 weeks ago in `Vulkan 1.3.320` and hasn't even made it to ash "proper": https://github.com/ash-rs/ash/pull/667. Apologies for the confusion!

Ohhh okay.
Btw would be really useful to have [VK_EXT_graphics_pipeline_library](https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_EXT_graphics_pipeline_library.html).
[Article on how it was used at Valve](https://www.khronos.org/blog/reducing-draw-time-hitching-with-vk-ext-graphics-pipeline-library)

Note that the main application of that extension is for porting legacy code. Projects that aren't structured around legacy GL/DX patterns don't have the problems it solves, as discussed in the article. People developing on Rust are unlikely to be porting legacy code.

Well, I'm making a creative coding API and this makes my life easier :) 
Edit: actually, after looking at it in more detail, i'm doubting it would be *that* useful to have.
``` vk::PhysicalDeviceShaderAtomicFloatFeaturesEXT``` exists, but the actual extension name i think is missing - ```VK_EXT_shader_atomic_float```

@wrightwriter it's right here?

https://github.com/ash-rs/ash/blob/29b935b1c176d6d53696beeaf09b7735ab4af5e7/ash/src/vk/extensions.rs#L14690-L14693

oh thanks, i thought the names are under extensions::***::Extension::name()
👍 It's mentioned in the readme
`VK_KHR_performance_query` seems to be partially implemented, probably just needs the wrapper.
@wolfiestyle added in https://github.com/ash-rs/ash/pull/726, please test!
[`VK_EXT_shader_object`](https://www.khronos.org/blog/you-can-use-vulkan-without-pipelines-today) was just released today! NVIDIA beta drivers already support it.
@phoekz see #723 for at least the low-level bindings, a high-level wrapper could be added later if needed.

> @phoekz see #723 for at least the low-level bindings, a high-level wrapper could be added later if needed.

I pulled directly from the `update` branch and got low-level bindings working fine. Are the high-level wrappers generated or written manually?

@phoekz Nice! The high-level wrapper is written manually, but was very easy this time around since the extension mainly enables existing `extended_dynamic_state*` functions which could just be copy-pasted. Find the wrapper in #732, which is based on top of #723.

Note that this copy-pasting is not something I'd like to keep doing, so I hope we can come up with some smarter wrapper that encapsulates a set of functions that may be enabled by multiple extensions, instead of duplicating them.

@wolfiestyle @phoekz both `VK_KHR_performance_query` and `VK_EXT_shader_object` have been merged to `master` and backported to the [`0.37-stable` branch](https://github.com/ash-rs/ash/tree/0.37-stable). I intend to do a `0.37` release soon, after fixing the breakage found in #727.

> @wolfiestyle @phoekz both `VK_KHR_performance_query` and `VK_EXT_shader_object` have been merged to `master` and backported to the [`0.37-stable` branch](https://github.com/ash-rs/ash/tree/0.37-stable). I intend to do a `0.37` release soon, after fixing the breakage found in #727.

Nice, that was fast :)! Looking forward to the 0.37 release.
Also https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_EXT_host_image_copy.html
@Super-Pizza that extension has been added to the list a long time ago via https://github.com/ash-rs/ash/pull/779
ah, I didn't see it...
Looks like `VK_EXT_metal_objects` is currently unimplemented. Happy to help with this if someone wants to steer me in the right direction!
I haven't seen any mentions of VK_KHR_map_memory2 being worked on yet. I would like to implement this extensions!

[VK_KHR_unified_image_layouts](https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/latest/man/html/VK_KHR_unified_image_layouts.html) is new, and helps simplify the number of image layout transitions.

Here's the [blog post](https://www.khronos.org/blog/so-long-image-layouts-simplifying-vulkan-synchronisation) introducing the new extension. It requires a recent driver, but is available even on old hardware. [gpuinfo](https://vulkan.gpuinfo.org/listdevicescoverage.php?platform=all&extension=VK_KHR_unified_image_layouts)

Forunately `VK_KHR_unified_image_layouts` does not define any new _commands_, so it does not belong in this list as it does not require any manual high-level abstractions to be implemented.

All it needs is a code regen on the latest Vulkan-Headers to have access to the new structs and constants, which we are postponing until we get all the breaking changes to the `generator` in to save ourselves constant code-conflict headaches. Both are dependencies for the next (major/breaking) release per [the `0.39` milestone](https://github.com/ash-rs/ash/milestone/2).

issueDTO.title: [ui] - Fixing spacings in the comment section
issueDTO.description: > Do you have attention to detail and would like to work on making the UI nicer? This issue is then for you! :)) ## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe. 1. Comment section is still not matching the designs. The whitespace is lacking between the nested comments and the visually it looks tight, packed and overwhelming. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c6340e9d-7671-4308-acd0-10bf42bffd4b) 2. Additionally the comment on mobile has spacing from the left, leaving the space not being utilised and making the text unnecessarily squeezed. Especially with nested comments it becomes obvious: 3. If the comment has some enters for new line and the the Show more button shows, it creates an awkward space. There is also gap applied. ## Describe the solution you'd like Generally I think this will need not only adjusting the numbers, but some minor restructuring of the divs. So, let me try to number the improvements: --- 1. Improving the spacings between the nested comments. In the designs there are also the useful buttons in each comment, that are not yet implemented. In the design however, the spacing occurs naturally because of the useful buttons, so I did not need to add a big margin-bottom. I will leave the solution here up to you, but account for the fact that one day in the future we will introduce the useful button for the comment. Don't be afraid to be generous with the spacings, in the devtools i tried 50px as in my designs --- 2. Mobile improvement. Here I upload a gif of the solution that I utilised in the Figma designs - it was to hide the left column with the avatar, allowing the text to stretch and then showing the avatar next to the username in 30x30px size. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/329f7267-8bdb-4d18-a47c-73b7e44d5478) Don't forget to make sure that the author's badge is working --- 3. Putting the Show More button directly under the comment, trimming the whitespaces. --- 4. Decreasing the gap here to 5px from 10px --- 5. As you can see, on mobile it gets quite tight. I would suggest removing the word Published from the "Published x time ago" information for the comments. --- 6. OPTIONAL - In case you would want to act on the point 5. above even more, I would suggest for mobile screens shortening the formulation even more, saying for example 1h ago, 3mo ago or 2yr ago. Reddit does it this way as well. --- 7. OPTIONAL - In case you would still be up for a challenge, having these 2 aligned on the baseline would be a nice achievement, however I didn't manage to get the desired result, since as you can see below, the align-items:baseline does not align them. ## Additional context - [FIGMA FILE HERE](https://www.figma.com/design/XYV3fr8UVOdkNyBmKHHR7f/CP---Comments-Useful---Mobile?node-id=48-79) You can find the figma file above. You can see the components, the desktop and the mobile versions. These design include the correct answer feature or the useful buttons, which are not yet implemented, so feel free to ignore those. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask. :))
comments:
@benfurber - I can take this up!

Although, if we are adding margin to fill the space where the useful count will go for comments, is there any reason not to go and implement the useful counter for comments? I'd be happy to include that as well.

Heyy @JCSergent! Cool to see that you are up for tackling these design improvements. 

Just yesterday we were talking with Ben, that this issue was in his opinion hard to follow and that the screenshots I included could be a bit confusing (some of them with the useful button, some without), so I thought about rewriting it. Is the issue clear to you though? If so, than let's keep it and if you find anything even slightly unclear you can tag me in the comments at any time and I'll be happy to give more clarification. :))

Also Ben mentioned that he does not have the capacity to prioritise this at the moment, so this would actually be really really helpful and valuable contribution from you. <3

Ben was also wrote yesterday that some of the points I mentioned were implemented already. After checking, it was only the point 5. - removing the word "Published" from the timestamp.

I will ask the team about implementing the useful counter and let you know. :))

@dalibormrska  - I think I understand it, but here let me try to summarize and let me know if I am understanding your requests correctly.


Request 1: Increase spacing between the nested comments.
Solutions:
- Long Term Solution: Add the Useful Counter to comments which will naturally add whitespace between the comments
- Easier Solution: Manually add whitespace between the nested comments (which is the space the Useful Counter will take up later)

Request 2: When viewing comments (especially reply comments) in mobile, the comment text is extremely narrow.
Solution: Remove the left side margin (make the comment text and profile image be on the same vertical line). Use the smaller version of the profile picture. Basically try to get to this design:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a4045704-088e-4a7c-a7ff-bf3d1c5535b3)

Request 3: If a comment has alot of line breaks, there could be an awkward gap between the comment text and the 'Show more' button
Solution: Remove line breaks from the end of the comment when hiding the rest of the comment behind the 'Show more' button

Request 4: Decrease Gap between profile/upload date line and comment body from 10px to 5px
Solution: This is straight forward :), just decrease gap from 10px to 5px

Request 5: Remove the 'Published ... time ago' part of the upload date to save space
Solution: Already Done :)

Request 6 (OPTIONAL): The upload date still takes alot of space on mobile
Solution: Use time short hand in mobile. For example, use '5h ago' instead of '5 hours ago' or '4mo ago' instead of '4 months ago'

Request 7 (OPTIONAL): The user flag, user name, and upload date are not aligned
Solution: Align the 3 on the baseline

Cool, well summarised, it's pretty much spot-on. :)) The only thing that got trickier since then is the Request 4. If you run the project locally or are a beta-tester, you will see that now the three-dots menu next to the top-comment has been implemented. The three-dots button is huge however, which makes the whole header of the top-comment taller than the replies and therefore makes it hard to achieve consistent gap. I don't know however what makes the most sense from the coding best practices - but I imagine if you tackle the Request 2. and include the avatar image in the comment header, then the whole header will get the height of the image. I would then suggest trying to make the image size and the three-dots menu size the same - let's try 35x35px and adjusting the gap accordingly. Other than that we just wait for @benfurber to assign. :))

I'm sceptical of making the avatar too small, otherwise what's the point of showing it.

It's yours @JCSergent.

One thing to note, I'm about to implement some icon changes which includes the pointing down arrow in these screenshots.

@benfurber - Yeah I could definitely see that. I'll go ahead and try to implement how the request has it, and we can put it in preview and see how it feels.

Okay cool, I'll keep an eye out for those icon changes.

issueDTO.title: Refactoring for Unit Test Access Controls
issueDTO.description:
Part of #12048

## Issue
After most of the Unit Test migration in #12048, there are a lot of inconsistencies in access control test methods. This is because we did not migrate the many convenient, abstracted, and commonly used access control test methods from `ui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java` to `sqlui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java`.

After merging #13254, all of the access control test methods in `BaseActionTest.java` have been migrated. Hence, this issue aims to refactor the unit test access controls to use these convenient test methods.

## Progress
The progress for this refactoring can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IcB-viJMrIOknYoBYasBuRBK9qnwY0-doEK4_Eb24IA/edit?gid=0#gid=0). I (the author) will update it when completed PRs are merged proactively.

## Steps to Contribute

1. Choose test(s) to work on in the above Google Sheets link
2. Check that no on else have claimed the test cases to work on within the last 2 weeks, or that it has been completed by follow up PRs (but not updated in the sheets)
3. Comment on this issue to indicate that you'd like to contribute on the chosen test(s). Update your comment if you need more than 2 weeks so that other contributors don't overlap with your work.
4. Create a PR to refactor the unit test(s).
5. Submit the PR, with a link to this issue by starting the description with "Part of #13304"## Tips

- Understand the access control test methods in `sqlui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java`, follow the refactoring in #13254
- Most of the access control testing logic in the migrated unit tests under `sqlui/webapi` follows the old unit tests under `ui/webapi`, so you may wish to reference the old unit test for help
comments:
**Good First Issue - Notes for Contributors**
  This issue is for **first-time contributors only**. If you are new to TEAMMATES, feel free to submit a PR for this issue.

*Please note that we allow only one `good first issue` per contributor.* If you have already made a prior contribution to TEAMMATES, you may wish to take a look at issues with the `help wanted` tag instead.

**We do not assign issues to contributors**. If you would like to pick up this issue, do post a comment below to express your interest and check if there is anyone else who is already working on the issue. We will do our best to reply and give you the go-ahead, but if we don't, feel free to submit a PR as long as there is no one else working on it.

**To get started**, do read through our [contributing guidelines](https://teammates.github.io/teammates/contributing-doc.html) carefully, and [set up a development environment on your local machine](https://teammates.github.io/teammates/setting-up.html) before making a PR.

If you need any clarifications on our [developer guide](https://teammates.github.io/teammates/index.html), or are facing issues that are not found in our [troubleshooting guide](https://teammates.github.io/teammates/troubleshooting-guide.html), please [post a message in our discussion forum](https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/discussions).

issueDTO.title: Avoid excessive use of `toarray` in unit tests
issueDTO.description:
Many of our unit tests compute the 2-norm of an error vector and compare it to a given tolerance. To this aim, unfortunately, they often convert a Psydac vector to a NumPy array, which is unnecessarily expensive:
```python
error = a - b
assert np.linalg.norm(error.toarray()) < TOL
```
Instead, the same result can be obtained by using the method `inner` of our `Vector` objects, without any unnecessary memory allocation:
```python
# Define 2-norm of vector using inner
norm2 = lambda v: sqrt(v.inner(v))

error = a - b
assert norm2(error) < TOL
```
comments:
While refactoring the `test_operator_evaluation` function (`/linalg/tests/test_linalg.py`) to remove all `.toarray() `(to better leverage PSYDAC???s native vector/matrix structures and improve efficiency), I noticed that the current computation of the variable `error_est` relies on a full dense inverse via:

```
Bmat = B.toarray()

B_inv_mat = np.linalg.inv(Bmat)
b_inv_arr = np.matrix.flatten(B_inv_mat)
error_est = 2 + n1 * n2 * np.max([np.abs(b_inv_arr[i]) for i in range(len(b_inv_arr))])

```
Since we???re avoiding those dense NumPy operations for performance and memory reasons, I believe this calculation of `error_est` no longer fits well in the new context. Computing the full inverse matrix is computationally expensive and somewhat contradictory to the iterative sparse methods we???re testing.

Could you suggest an alternative approach for `error_est`?
For example, I???m considering replacing it with a simpler, lightweight estimate such as:

`error_est = {some num > 0}* n1 * n2`

This is an error estimate based on the maximum absolute value of the inverse matrix. It could read in fact
```python
error_est = np.linalg.norm(Bmat.flat, np.inf)
```
which is the inf-norm of the vectorized matrix. This does not seem to give a sharp estimate, given that it is multiplied by a small number just below (`tol = 1e-5`). Maybe @jowezarek could shed some light on this?

@anushkasinghh @yguclu 
Thanks for bringing this up, this code snipped is ridiculously complicated and doesn't do what it's supposed to do :')

The explicit matrix inverse was never truly needed, and yet there's no time to gain as the entire test ran in < 3 seconds on my machine.

This particular part of the test was designed to test whether power operations (**0, **1, **2) work with inverse linear operators (ILOs).

The poorly executed idea of the test was the following:
```python
# arbitrary tolerance
tol = 

# Define 2-norm of vector using inner (as proposed by Yaman)
norm2 = lambda v: sqrt(v.inner(v))

# Psydac objects, solver with tolerance = tol
u
B_ILO = inverse(B, 'cg', tol=tol)

# First test: Check whether B_ILO**0 is the identity matrix (B_ILO**0 = id?)

error = (B_ILO**0) @ u - u
assert norm2(error) < 1e-15 # error should really be zero

# Second test: Check whether B_ILO**1 really computes the inverse up to accuracy (B_ILO**1 = B_ILO?)
# I.e., we expect B @ B_ILO**1 @ u to be equal to u + err, err a vector of norm less than tol

error = B @ B_ILO**1 @ u - u
assert norm2(error) < tol

# Third test: Now checking whether B_ILO**2 is really equal to a double application of B_ILO (B_ILO**2 = B_ILO @ B_ILO?)
# B @ B @ B_ILO @ B_ILO @ u = B @ ( B_ILO @ u + err1 ) = u + err2 + B @ err1
# where both err1 and err2 are vectors of norm less than tol, hence
# | B @ B @ B_ILO @ B_ILO @ u - u | = | err2 + B @ err1 | < | err2 | + | B @ err1 | < tol + |B|_{inf} * tol = (1 + |B|_{inf}) * tol

adjusted_tol = ( 1 + np.max(np.abs(B.toarray())) ) * tol
error = B @ B @ B_ILO**2 @ u - u
assert norm2(error) < adjusted_tol

So if I understand correctly, the old error estimate was:
```
error_est = 2 + n1 * n2 * np.max([np.abs(b_inv_arr[i]) for i in range(len(b_inv_arr))])
assert norm2((B @ bi22) - bi12) < error_est * tol
```

@jowezarek 's suggestion improves this by incorporating a more accurate error bound:
```
error_est = (1 + norm(B)) * tol # or error_est = (1 + np.max(np.abs(B.toarray())) ) * tol
error = B @ B @ B_ILO**2 @ u - u
assert norm2(error) < error_est

```
This should yield a more reliable tolerance without significant performance cost.

issueDTO.title: Add Support for Dynamic "s3_bucket" in data routing based on resource attributes
issueDTO.description:
### Component(s)

exporter/awss3

### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

We want to separate data storage at the bucket level in S3, based on resource attributes. Currently, this requires us to configure a new exporter each time a new bucket is introduced, which becomes difficult to manage at scale.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Since dynamic "s3_prefix" support already exists, it would be great to extend this functionality to also support "s3_bucket", allowing the bucket name to be derived from resource attributes dynamically.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

I'm not very familiar with Go, so I'm hoping the owners can take this on. I assume this feature would be relatively straightforward to implement, given that similar logic already exists for s3_prefix.

 See [Adding Labels via Comments](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#adding-labels-via-comments) if you do not have permissions to add labels yourself.

issueDTO.title: [Bug Report]: OpenAI Provider Returns 404 Error While Direct API Calls Work Fine
issueDTO.description: ### Version agent-tars/0.2.7 darwin-arm64 node-v22.17.0 ### Issue Type - [ ] Select a issue type 👇 - [ ] Agent TARS Web UI (`@agent-tars/web-ui`) - [ ] Agent TARS CLI (`@agent-tars/server`) - [ ] Agent TARS Server (`@agent-tars/server`) - [x] Agent TARS (`@agent-tars/core`) - [ ] MCP Agent (`@mcp-agent/core`) - [ ] Agent Kernel (`@multimodal/agent`) - [ ] Other (please specify in description) ### Model Provider - [ ] Select a model provider 👇 - [ ] Volcengine - [ ] Anthropic - [x] OpenAI - [ ] Azure OpenAI - [ ] Other (please specify in description) ### Problem Description ## Bug Description Agent TARS consistently returns "404 Resource not found" error when using the OpenAI provider, despite direct OpenAI API calls working correctly with the same API key and network configuration. ## Environment - **Network**: China mainland with proxy configuration - **Proxy**: 127.0.0.1:4780 ## Problem Summary ### ??? **OpenAI Provider** (FAILS) - **Provider**: `openai` - **Model**: `gpt-4o` - **API Key**: Valid (verified with curl) - **Error**: `404 Resource not found` - **Occurs in**: Both CLI and Web UI ### ??? **Direct OpenAI API Call** (WORKS) ```bash curl -x http://127.0.0.1:4780 https://api.openai.com/v1/models \ -H "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY" # Returns normal model list successfully ``` ## Reproduction Steps ### Command Line ```bash agent-tars run \ --input "Find information about UI TARS" \ --model.provider openai \ --model.id gpt-4o \ --model.apiKey {my-api-key} \ --format json ``` **Result:** ```json { "sessionId": "3zvvbfEkWEIYgS2Iz19Nm", "result": { "id": "3526d2b3-bcde-40a2-beb0-9abb1bb6b322", "type": "assistant_message", "timestamp": 1751442535990, "content": "Sorry, an error occurred while processing your request: Error: 404 Resource not found", "finishReason": "error" } ``` ### Web UI ```bash agent-tars \ --provider openai \ --model gpt-4o \ --apiKey {my-api-key} ``` **Result:** Same "404 Resource not found" error in web interface. ## Evidence That API Key and Network Are Valid ### Direct API Verification ```bash # Test 1: List models curl -x http://127.0.0.1:4780 https://api.openai.com/v1/models \ -H "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY" # ??? SUCCESS: Returns complete model list # Test 2: Chat completion curl -x http://127.0.0.1:4780 https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions \ -H "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{"model":"gpt-4o","messages":[{"role":"user","content":"Hi"}],"max_tokens":1}' # ??? SUCCESS: Returns valid response ``` Both direct API calls work perfectly with the same API key and proxy configuration. ## Configuration Attempted ```typescript // agent-tars.config.ts import { defineConfig } from '@agent-tars/interface'; export default defineConfig({ model: { provider: 'openai', id: 'gpt-4o', apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY, }, browser: { control: 'dom', }, }); ``` ## Comparison with Other Providers - **Doubao (volcengine)**: ??? Works perfectly in Agent TARS - **OpenAI**: ??? 404 error in Agent TARS, ??? works with direct API calls I'm wondering if this issue is related to my local environment, or Agent TARS itself. Thank you! ### Error Logs

The algorithm should also be able to handle graphs with varying densities and sizes.
summary.attemptedFixes: The proposed solution includes implementing an incremental K-Core algorithm using a combination of vertex-centric and edge-centric computations. issueDTO.title: Extend type hints in the classifiers and regressors
issueDTO.description:
<!-- ?????? If you do not respect this template, your issue will be closed -->
<!-- ?????? Make sure to browse the opened and closed issues to confirm this idea does not exist. -->

### What is the expected behavior?
Since we are going to introduce categorical labels (and perhaps categorical features), I think, we can re-consider type hints for the classifiers and regressors and make them more like in Scikit-Learn: `array_like`. This may allow to pass plain lists or other types. As an example take a look at the interface here: https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.LinearRegression.html

This issue is just for discussion.
comments: @adekusar-drl, could you please share an example or template of how you'd match the SKlearn type hinting for QML?

It has been a low priority for a long time, things might have changed. While scikit learn does not expose type hints by default, one of the possible options to take a look at https://numpy.org/doc/stable/reference/typing.html#module-numpy.typing. Numpy has `ArrayLike` type hint and it may work. This issue is more exploratory one rather something that can be easily implemented. Even if numpy's hinting is good enough, I'd first double check if such hinting brings in any value, not problems.

For instance
https://github.com/qiskit-community/qiskit-machine-learning/blob/c59063af02afbb56cfdb27408068aa1c0f5bc718/qiskit_machine_learning/algorithms/classifiers/pegasos_qsvc.py#L128-L130
would become
```python
import numpy.typing as npt

def fit( 
     self, X: npt.ArrayLike, y: npt.ArrayLike, sample_weight: npt.ArrayLike | None = None 
 ) -> "PegasosQSVC": 
```
or, more strictly,
```python
import numpy.typing as npt

def fit( 
     self, X: npt.NDArray[np.float64], y: npt.NDArray[np.float64], sample_weight: npt.NDArray[np.float64] | None = None 
 ) -> "PegasosQSVC": 
```
While young, the new typing in Numpy is covered by tests and CI, and made it into a major release. So I'd consider the basic features relatively stable.

Mypy can also be configured to account for strongly typed Numpy objects as
```
[mypy]
plugins = numpy.typing.mypy_plugin
```
See https://numpy.org/doc/stable/reference/typing.html .
Can i work in this issue ?

issueDTO.title: Don't suggest importing internal modules
issueDTO.description:
Currently, the "import module" code action will suggest importing internal modules from other packages:
```gleam
pub fn main() {
  internal_module.something() // Suggests "import `some_package/internal_module`"
}
```
We do not want this. The code action should only suggest public modules from other packages

repository.description: ?????? A friendly language for building type-safe, scalable systems!
repository.name: gleam

summary.main: Do not suggest importing internal modules
summary.validationOrRequirement: The code action should only suggest public modules from other packages.
summary.attemptedFixes: No attempts or blockers mentioned in the description or comments.
summary.otherNotes: The issue description includes a code snippet to illustrate the problem and a mention of the expected behavior.

issueDTO.title: [DAG] SDPatternMatch - m_Zero can't see through bitcasts
issueDTO.description:
X86 uses ISD::isBuildVectorAllZeros to peek through bitcasts to match zero vectors in a large number of combines.

Ideally we'd use SDPatternMatch to match these combines and use m_Zero() instead, but regrettably this fails to match the zero vectors through bitcasts,

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/84397c61f44e62231d1876a745a0c1f74ea8a5b8 shows an example of the regression

If we convert m_Zero() to something closer to m_AllOnes / AllOnes_match we might be able to make this work.
comments:
Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor has already been assigned to this issue. If you believe that no one is actually working on it despite an assignment, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. In the comments of this issue, request for it to be assigned to you, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.

@llvm/issue-subscribers-good-first-issue

Author: Simon Pilgrim (RKSimon)

<details>
X86 uses ISD::isBuildVectorAllZeros to peek through bitcasts to match zero vectors in a large number of combines.

Ideally we'd use SDPatternMatch to match these combines and use m_Zero() instead, but regrettably this fails to match the zero vectors through bitcasts,

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/84397c61f44e62231d1876a745a0c1f74ea8a5b8 shows an example of the regression

If we convert m_Zero() to something closer to m_AllOnes / AllOnes_match we might be able to make this work.
</details>
Hi, I'd like to work on this issue. Could the issue be assigned to me? Thanks!
Good luck! Please keep this ticket updated with your progress so nobody thinks it has been abandoned.
@average-avancha Any progress?

Hi @RKSimon, sorry for the delay but I managed to put together a fix that should allow m_Zero to peek through bitcasts. I'm still testing the solution locally but I think it should work.

Here's my fix on a fork of the repo: https://github.com/average-avancha/llvm-project/pull/1

I can move forward with an actual PR once I'm done locally testing.
I'd appreciate any feedback, thanks!
@average-avancha The patch looks like it's just for IR PatternMatch, have you made any progress on the DAG SDPatternMatch equivalent?
Not at the moment, seems like my effort was misguided. I'll work through the DAG SDPatternMatch section. Sorry about the confusion.
@average-avancha reverse-ping
@RKSimon if @average-avancha isn???t actively working on this, I???d like to claim this issue
ping @average-avancha
I've raised #146871 as there are issues with inconsistent tolerance of undef elements in m_One/m_Zero/m_AllOnes that need addressing as well.

issueDTO.title: [FEATURE] <Social Sharing Buttons on Blogs>
issueDTO.description:
### Why do we need this improvement?

Currently, the website lacks a mechanism for users to easily share blog posts on social media platforms. This limits the reach and visibility of the content, making it harder for readers to promote the blogs organically to a broader audience.

### How will this change help?

This change will ease the sharing of blog amongst social platforms.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### How could it be implemented/designed?

Add social sharing buttons to each blog post. These buttons should allow users to share the post on popular platforms such as:

    Twitter
    LinkedIn

Each button should generate a pre-filled sharing link, including the blog post title, URL, and possibly hashtags. For example:

```Twitter: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Check+out+this+blog!&url=https://www.asyncapi.com/blog/2024-annual-summary#social-media```

The buttons should be visually appealing, lightweight, and non-intrusive. They can be displayed at the top or bottom of each blog post.

### 🚧 Breaking changes

Yes

### 👀 Have you checked for similar open issues?

- [x] I checked and didn't find a similar issue

### 🏢 Have you read the Contributing Guidelines?

- [x] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/asyncapi/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Are you willing to work on this issue?

Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

issueDTO.title: Extend `/health` to add instances
issueDTO.description:
### Feature request

We have endpoints to list models (OpenAI spec), endpoints (#1037 ) but not yet instances. I was expecting we'd have some kind of cluster management system that handled that, but it seems we need this sooner.

Extend the `/health` endpoint to include instances. Add a function in `lib/runtime` to list them in etcd - see `component.rs` `list_instances` for an example (that one only lists the instances of a Component).


### Describe the problem you're encountering

/

### Describe alternatives you've tried

_No response_
comments:
May I  try it as my first issue, thanks
/assign
/assign
Please both go for it! Even if we don't merge your contribution it will be a nice chance to explore the code base and maybe improve your Rust.

Hi,

I'd like to pick up this issue (#1312) and work on extending the `/health` endpoint to include instance listings.

Before I dive in, could you please provide any updated information or context related to this feature request? Specifically:
* Has any preliminary work been started or design decisions made since this issue was opened?
* Are there any specific details or status fields that should be included for each instance in the `/health` response?

Also, what would be the recommended approach for testing this new functionality?

Thanks!
Go for it. No changes since the issue was posted. Include a unit test.

issueDTO.title: [Documentation] Update the "Extending CUDA-Q with a new Simulator" page
issueDTO.description:
The "_Extending CUDA-Q with a new Simulator_" doc [page](https://nvidia.github.io/cuda-quantum/latest/using/extending/nvqir_simulator.html) is out of date w.r.t. the current code.

For example,

- the "MySimulator.cpp" code snippet does not reflect the latest `CircuitSimulatorBase` interface.

- the CMakeLists.txt snippet is using an old signature of the `nvqir_add_backend` CMake function (missing the `GPURequirements` argument)


Hence, we need to review and update this page. Ideally, we should have this doc page pull code from `.cpp`/`CMakeLists.txt` files that are validated by the CI.

issueDTO.title: Update in progress button state for consistency
issueDTO.description: ## Feature Description When a button has a related "in progress" state such as a navigation or background request, we don't always handle this consistently. This is similar to #10281 but specific to the appearance. For example, when saving settings [we include an ellipsis](https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/8f1c16bb71bcf5091bc5b56d535e03973d4b9b36/assets/js/components/settings/SettingsActiveModule/Footer.js#L153-L155), but in nearly all other similar buttons we do not. --------------- _Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._ ## Acceptance criteria * When module settings are being saved, after CTA has been clicked and CTA enters in progress state, only spinner icon should be showing, text shouldn't be changing to the `Saving` and ellipsis should not show `...` ## Implementation Brief * [x] Update `assets/js/components/settings/SettingsActiveModule/FooterPrimaryAction.js` * Remove https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/4946f1a5df79dfac2ac8f94c6a03283a163241a1/assets/js/components/settings/SettingsActiveModule/FooterPrimaryAction.js#L75 and conditional wrapper around it. * Spinner is already integrated, so no further change is needed ### Test Coverage * No updates expected ## QA Brief 1. Open any module's settings in `Site Kit > Settings`. 2. Make any changes to the module, when the settings are being saved, the button text should stay as `Confirm changes` and not `Saving...`. Refer attached screenshots. #### Before #### Latest change ## Changelog entry * Update the "Confirm changes" module settings button to retain its label while saving.
comments: I have reached out to @sigal-teller and @marrrmarrr in Slack about how best to handle this, [see Slack conversation here](https://fueled10up.slack.com/archives/C01CA828ZPZ/p1741178336319719).
Based on the thread in the slack referenced in previous comment - buttons should keep the spinner only, and legacy elipsis/text change should be removed
@zutigrm this shouldn't be only specific for module settings. We need to do it for all progress button across our codebase to make sure we have consistent approach everywhere.

Thanks @eugene-manuilov, I know AC is more module settings centric, but it's because we do not have this occurrence anywhere else in our codebase, this is the only place we need to remove/update it. All other buttons use spinner without ellipsis
Ah, thanks for clarifying it, @zutigrm. AC ???
IB ???

issueDTO.title: Support automatically opening with com.epicgames.launcher://store links
issueDTO.description:
### Problem description

Hey :wave: 

Epic is famous for giving free games every now and then, and I have a Discord bot that alerts me whenever there's a new one available, including a link to the game in question, which on windows opens the epic client on the page of the game.

E.g.: Currently the free game is https://store.epicgames.com/p/melvor-idle-b6a9b3, and its link to open on the epic client is com.epicgames.launcher://store/p/melvor-idle-b6a9b3, so the `melvor-idle-b6a9b3` is the important part here, which indicates the game to go to.

On linux with the heroic games launcher, it just opens firefox `com.epicgames.launcher://store/p/melvor-idle-b6a9b3`, but obviously firefox doesn't know what to do with it. 

### Feature description

Would it be possible to have the same behaviour from the epic games client on the heroic client, opening the game on the store page? Would be very handy for those cases :smile: 

### Alternatives

_No response_

### Additional information

This is a duplicate of https://github.com/Heroic-Games-Launcher/HeroicGamesLauncher/issues/918, which unfortunately was closed by the author
comments: I've run into this too. Please support opening links from games in Firefox too.
Does this codebase support claiming games from Epic Games Store already? I'm trying to understand more about this codebase.

Heroic does not have any feature to claim Epic games

> 
> Heroic does not have any feature to claim Epic games

issueDTO.title: Tenor and alt clef swapped
issueDTO.description:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

I believe that the tenor clef and alto clefs are swapped in alphaTex. Setting the clef to tenor gives you an alto clef, and setting the clef to alto gives you a tenor clef.

### Expected Behavior

`\clef Tenor` should show a tenor clef, and `\clef Alto` should give an alto clef

### Steps To Reproduce

Inputting the alphaTex `\clef Alto` outputs a tenor clef

### Link to jsFiddle, CodePen, Project

_No response_

### Version and Environment

```bash
Visible in both https://alphatab.net/docs/playground/ and android version 1.3.0. Indicated on https://alphatab.net/docs/alphatex/bar-metadata#clef
```

### Platform

Web

### Anything else?

_No response_

issueDTO.title: Failure in compile
issueDTO.description:
<!--

Thanks for opening an issue! To help the Numba team handle your information
efficiently, please first ensure that there is no other issue present that
already describes the issue you have
(search at https://github.com/numba/numba/issues?&q=is%3Aissue).

-->

## Reporting a bug

<!--

Before submitting a bug report please ensure that you can check off these boxes:

-->

- [x] I have tried using the latest released version of Numba (most recent is
  visible in the release notes
  (https://numba.readthedocs.io/en/stable/release-notes-overview.html).

  i.e. it's possible to run as 'python bug.py'.

<!--

Please include details of the bug here, including, if applicable, what you
expected to happen!

-->

```python
@njit
def _nan_maximum_impl(args):
    result = np.empty(args[0].shape, dtype=args[0].dtype)
    l = len(args)
    for idx, max_value in np.ndenumerate(args[0]):
        for k in range(1, l):
            this_value = args[k][idx]
            if this_value > max_value or np.isnan(max_value):
                max_value = this_value
        result[idx] = max_value
    return result
```

_nan_maximum_impl((np.array(1.0), ))

--> 664     ty = values[0].type
    665 ary = ir.ArrayType(ty, n)(ir.Undefined)
    666 for i, v in enumerate(values):

IndexError: list index out of range


```
comments:
This seems to be a case of lack of default value, it looks like the logic at:

https://github.com/numba/numba/blob/0c633b896526b039171c0f800df70320e1c61a53/numba/np/arrayobj.py#L3886

This was built with the intent to make an array of indices but always assumed that the indices would always be present. However in this case they aren't. And `pack_array` clearly states that:

https://github.com/numba/numba/blob/0c633b896526b039171c0f800df70320e1c61a53/numba/core/cgutils.py#L659-L663

So therefore the fix out to be something like:

```
diff --git a/numba/np/arrayobj.py b/numba/np/arrayobj.py
index ccb61b670..5fa670a86 100644
--- a/numba/np/arrayobj.py
+++ b/numba/np/arrayobj.py
@@ -3883,7 +3883,7 @@ def _make_flattening_iter_cls(flatiterty, kind):
                                                                      indices,
                                                                      dim))
                                    for dim in range(ndim)]
-                        idxtuple = cgutils.pack_array(builder, idxvals)
+                        idxtuple = cgutils.pack_array(builder, idxvals, ty=context.get_data_type(types.intp))
                         result.yield_(
                             cgutils.make_anonymous_struct(builder,
                                                           [idxtuple, value]))
```

Since array indices are always of type `intp`.

repository.description: NumPy aware dynamic Python compiler using LLVM
repository.name: numba

summary.main: The issue is a failure to compile due to a lack of default value in the logic at https://github.com/numba/numba/blob/0c633b896526b039171c0f800df70320e1c61a53/numba/np/arrayobj.py#L3886
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue seems to be related to the way the array indices are handled, specifically the `pack_array` function. The function assumes that the indices will always be present, but in this case they aren't.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix is to add a default value to the `pack_array` function, specifically setting `ty=context.get_data_type(types.intp)`
summary.otherNotes: The issue seems to be a lack of default value in the logic at https://github.com/numba/numba/blob/0c633b896526b039171c0f800df70320e1c61a53/numba/np/arrayobj.py#L3886. The code assumes that the indices will always be present, but in this case they aren't. The fix is to add a default value, for example by setting `ty=context.get_data_type(types.intp)`.

issueDTO.title: Track and Manage Puzzle History
issueDTO.description:
A self-contained PuzzleVersioningModule for storing and managing version history of puzzles. This allows admins to view all past edits, track changes over time, and retrieve the most recent version when needed. Useful for auditing and improving content reliability over time.

**Tasks:**

* [ ] Create `PuzzleVersion` entity to store versioned puzzle data (title, content, timestamp, etc.)
* [ ] Implement logic to fetch and return the latest version of any given puzzle
* [ ] Build an admin-only endpoint or view that lists all versions of a puzzle chronologically

issueDTO.title: Daily Login Rewards System
issueDTO.description:
This standalone DailyRewardModule implements a daily check-in system that rewards users for logging in each day. It includes support for streak tracking and cooldown enforcement to ensure users can only claim rewards once per day. This feature is designed to boost user retention and daily engagement.

**Tasks:**

* [ ] Create `DailyRewardLog` entity to track user check-ins and streaks
* [ ] Implement logic for streak counting and cooldown (24-hour restriction)
* [ ] Create `POST /rewards/daily-checkin` endpoint to claim the reward and return current streak info

issueDTO.title: Track and Aggregate User Location Data
issueDTO.description:
A self-contained GeoStatsModule that captures and aggregates user location data (based on IP address) for analytics and insights. It enables features like tracking where users are engaging from and generating geographical usage statistics. No dependency on other modules.

**Tasks:**

* [ ] Create `GeoStats` entity to store user IP, country, and timestamp
* [ ] Integrate with a public IP-to-country resolution service (e.g., ip-api, ipdata)
* [ ] Build a public API endpoint to return aggregated stats (e.g., user count per country)

issueDTO.title: Standardize setup instructions
issueDTO.description:
We should make installation and setup as seamless as possible to facilitate the growth of the FLE community. I've already attempted to address some of the process (environment container management) in #193 . But before setting that up there are other steps which could be better standardized.

One source of ambiguity which could be resolved is whether to use the steam or factorio.com version of the game client. I'm using the factorio.com version and it worked without any issues. **I think using factorio.com should be the standard approach** since steam has its own state and update cycle and it's unclear how that will interact with the docker images built in the repo.

For postgres I also had to run a command similar to the one in the README for sqlite. Unclear if others had to do something similar. This is what I ran in my Postgres factorio db:
```sql
CREATE TABLE programs (
id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
code TEXT NOT NULL,
value REAL DEFAULT 0.0,
visits INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
parent_id INTEGER,
state_json TEXT,
conversation_json TEXT NOT NULL,
completion_token_usage INTEGER,
prompt_token_usage INTEGER,
token_usage INTEGER,
response TEXT,
holdout_value REAL,
raw_reward REAL,
version INTEGER DEFAULT 1,
version_description TEXT DEFAULT '',
model TEXT DEFAULT 'gpt-4o',
meta TEXT,
achievements_json TEXT,
instance INTEGER DEFAULT -1,
depth REAL DEFAULT 0.0,
advantage REAL DEFAULT 0.0,
ticks INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);
```

This is all I have in my notes for installation hiccups. Please add your own notes to the thread, especially if there are unresolved issues! We can consolidate findings into another PR.
comments:
Another question to address is in the docker file where somebody using a silicon Mac would need to replace ARM with AMD, if I'm not mistaken.

[This file](https://github.com/JackHopkins/factorio-learning-environment/blob/main/cluster/docker/Dockerfile#L1-L2) is what I'm referring to.
Good catch. I think when I got started I casually changed it and didn't bother committing it.

We can close this once we update the readme post-restructure.
@JackHopkins do we want to keep the updates section of the readme in our next release?

```
## Updates
- [08/5/2025] [Blog](https://jackhopkins.github.io/factorio-learning-environment/release.0.2.0): Added support for multi-agent coordination and MCP allowing reasoning models to invoke tools within their reasoning chain
- [15/4/2025] Added a visual agent, that takes a rendering of the map as an additional input.
```

issueDTO.title: Add support for DefaultAzureCredential chain to use instead of OpenAI key
issueDTO.description:
Using DefaultAzureCredential paves the way for using any type authentication supported in Azure including service principals and managed identity. These types of credentials in conjunction with Azure RBAC model are way more likely to be used in production environments than static key. 

In this case following model 
```yaml
apiVersion: kagent.dev/v1alpha1
kind: ModelConfig
metadata:
  name: azureopenai-model-config
  namespace: kagent
spec:
  apiKeySecretName: kagent-azureopenai
  apiKeySecretKey: AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY
  model: gpt-4o-mini
  provider: AzureOpenAI
  azureOpenAI:
    azureEndpoint: "https://<endpointname>.openai.azure.com/"
    apiVersion: "2025-03-01-preview"
    azureDeployment: "gpt-4o-mini"
    azureAdToken: <token>
```
should be able to pickup SPN or Azure Managed Identity credentials from secret and use them to obtain token from `https://cognitiveservices.azure.com/.default` endpoint
comments:
Oh. That's a tricky one!

We could enable workload identity injection for the azure to utilize security best practices, but...
The identity will be injected into the service-account token used by the engine's pod
So the tricky part is, that we could use this mechanism only for one configuration at a time. If other user would like to add their own identity, it would require additional deployment.

We could give the user ability to inject the token manually but:
- tokens won't live forever (usualy 1h)
- getting the token could be problematic for non-technical users

Since workload identity is needed only to get the token from Azure I think adding a job just for this could be a solution. 
This job could be ran using special service account which would be integrated with managed identity. When token is needed this is initiated by main deployment fetch it and return the value to the deployment pod.
same solution can be applied to AWS and GKE workload identies I guess to make the approach more universal.

repository.description: Cloud Native Agentic AI | Discord: https://bit.ly/kagentdiscord
repository.name: kagent

summary.validationOrRequirement: The model configuration should be able to pickup SPN or Azure Managed Identity credentials from a secret and use them to obtain a token from https://cognitiveservices.azure.com/.default endpoint
summary.attemptedFixes: Enabling workload identity injection, giving the user ability to inject the token manually, adding a job to fetch the token from Azure
summary.otherNotes: The issue is tricky as it requires workload identity injection for security best practices, but this mechanism can only be used for one configuration at a time. Tokens won't live forever and getting the token could be problematic for non-technical users.

Looks like we used to have a `widths` prop for `<ToolbarItem />` that was commented out in a core bump (and later removed) - https://github.com/patternfly/patternfly-react/pull/10022. Digging into that, it looks like it was because the CSS variables used with that prop were removed accidentally (https://github.com/patternfly/patternfly/pull/6057/files), which probably broke the core bump, so that feature was commented out.  Then we added the vars back in core (https://github.com/patternfly/patternfly/pull/6302/files) and never added the `widths` prop back.

Also there is a `.pf-m-flex-grow[on-{breakpoint}]` modifier in core that can go on `<ToolbarItem />` and `<ToolbarGroup />` that we should add a react prop for.

issueDTO.title: Verify signature locally
issueDTO.description:
## Description 📹

**Currently, verifying signatures on Starknet via `is_valid_signature` fails if the account is not deployed. This leads to the error: "your wallet is not yet initialized, please make a transaction (sending ETH to yourself works) to initialize it." To support undeployed accounts, we propose directly verifying the signature using the public key (account address), bypassing the need to interact with the account's contract.**

## Proposed Actions 🛠???

Here???s a checklist of actions to follow for resolving this issue:

1. **Fork and Create Branch**:  
   Fork the repository and create a new branch using the issue number:
   
```bash
   git checkout -b fix-[issue-number]
```

2. **Implement Changes**:  
- [ ] Create a utility function to verify Starknet signatures using public keys directly.
- [ ] Integrate this function as a fallback when account is not yet deployed.
- [ ] Detect if an account is deployed or not before calling `is_valid_signature`.
- [ ] Add error handling and logging for both methods of verification.
- [ ] Write unit tests for both deployed and undeployed account scenarios.

Example snippet for direct signature verification:
```python
def verify_signature(pubkey, message_hash, signature):
    # Apply Starknet signature verification logic using elliptic curve math
    return starknet_ec_verify(pubkey, message_hash, signature)
```

3. **Run Tests and Commit Changes**:  
   Make sure your changes don't break existing functionality and commit with a clear message:
   
```bash
   git commit -m "Fix: Allow signature verification for undeployed Starknet accounts"
```

## Required 📋

To keep our workflow smooth, please make sure you follow these guidelines:

- **Assignment**: Don't create a pull request if you weren???t assigned to this issue.
- **Timeframe**: Complete the task within **3 business days**.
- **Closing the Issue**: In your PR description, close the issue by writing Close #[issue_id].
- **Review Process**:
  - Once you've submitted your PR, change the label to **"ready for review"**.
  - If changes are requested, address them and then update the label back to **"ready for review"** once done.
- **Testing**: Test your PR locally before pushing, and verify that tests and build are working after pushing.

Thank you for your contribution 🙏

?????? WARNING: Failure to follow the requirements above may result in being added to the OnlyDust blacklist, affecting your ability to receive future rewards.

issueDTO.title: [FEATURE] Conversion Utilities
issueDTO.description:
## Feature Description

A Go package that provides a set of utility functions to perform conversions between commonly used units such as bytes, time, and temperature.

---

## Use Case

Many applications require frequent conversions between data sizes (bytes to MB), time units (seconds to hours), and temperature units (Celsius to Fahrenheit). Instead of reimplementing this logic repeatedly, a centralized utility package allows for clean, reusable, and testable conversion functions across different services and applications.

---

## Proposed Solution

Create a new `convert` package. The package will expose clearly named functions to convert:

- Data Sizes: Bytes ??? KB ??? MB ??? GB
- Time: Seconds ??? Minutes ??? Hours ??? Days
- Temperature: Celsius ??? Fahrenheit ??? Kelvin

The package will use constants for unit multipliers where applicable, and follow idiomatic Go function naming.

---

## Additional Context

This utility package is meant to be lightweight and dependency-free. The logic should avoid third-party libraries and be kept easily testable and benchmarkable. The package can be expanded in the future to support additional categories (e.g., distance, volume, speed).

---

## Pseudo Code

```go
// Data size conversion functions
func BytesToKB(b int64) float64
func KBToBytes(kb float64) int64
func BytesToMB(b int64) float64
func MBToBytes(mb float64) int64
func BytesToGB(b int64) float64
func GBToBytes(gb float64) int64

// Time conversion functions
func SecondsToMinutes(s int64) int64
func MinutesToSeconds(m int64) int64
func MinutesToHours(m int64) int64
func HoursToMinutes(h int64) int64
func HoursToDays(h int64) int64
func DaysToHours(d int64) int64

// Temperature conversion functions
func CelsiusToFahrenheit(c float64) float64
func FahrenheitToCelsius(f float64) float64
func CelsiusToKelvin(c float64) float64
func KelvinToCelsius(k float64) float64
func FahrenheitToKelvin(f float64) float64
func KelvinToFahrenheit(k float64) float64

repository.description: Lightweight and versatile utilities for Go 📦
repository.name: utils

summary.validationOrRequirement: The package should be lightweight and dependency-free, and should avoid third-party libraries.
summary.attemptedFixes: No attempted fixes mentioned in the issue description or comments.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is about creating a Go package that provides utility functions for conversions between commonly used units such as bytes, time, and temperature. The package will be lightweight and dependency-free, and will be easily testable and benchmarkable.

issueDTO.title: Update ESlinted acronyms
issueDTO.description:
## Feature Description

The list of acronyms that Site Kit enforces casing for should be reviewed and updated to make sure we're covering all the instances that it should be. Offending code is usually references from Google APIs. One such violation that isn't currently covered is `URI`, but there may be others we should add that have slipped by.

---------------

_Do not alter or remove anything below. The following sections will be managed by moderators only._

## Acceptance criteria

* The list of acronyms that Site Kit enforces casing for is updated to include the following additional acronyms::
  * `SDK` 
  * `EMM` 
  * `REST` 
  * `GKE` 
  * `URI`  
  * `UX`  
  * `OS` 
  * `GCP` 
  * `DNS`  
  * `FCM`  
  * `IAM` 
  * `IP` 
  * `ISO`

## Implementation Brief

* [x] In `packages/eslint-plugin/rules/acronym-case.js`
  * Expand the list of Acronyms to include the items listed in AC https://github.com/google/site-kit-wp/blob/3eacb691d9d832ac0f473f17e54c1bb581205a89/packages/eslint-plugin/rules/acronym-case.js#L108


### Test Coverage

* Include few new acronyms to the list of existing tests in `packages/eslint-plugin/rules/acronym-case.test.js`

## QA:Eng Brief

* Run unit tests for `acronym-case.js`.
* Confirm new acronyms (`SDK`, `EMM`, `REST`, `GKE`, `URI`, `UX`, `OS`, `GCP`, `DNS`, `FCM`, `IAM`, `IP`, `ISO`) are correctly flagged when casing is incorrect (e.g., `Sdk`).
* Verify new acronyms pass when casing is correct (e.g., `sdk`, `SDK_CONSTANT`).
* Ensure existing acronyms (e.g., `HTML`, `JSON`, `ID`) still behave as expected.
* Check that ignored cases (imports, function calls, global objects) continue to be ignored.


## Changelog entry

* <!-- One sentence summarizing the PR, to be used in the changelog. -->

issueDTO.title: Support a unique interface to the logger crate
issueDTO.description:
Currently the format for `defmt` and `log` and different. It would be much more convenient to have a unique syntax for a common (and restricted) subset of those, typically to print common types like integers, strings, and bytes.

The idea would be to change the logger crate to be a proc-macro crate, and do the format conversion logic at compile-time. The goal is that such logic: https://github.com/google/wasefire/blob/ac32ec709398c325c0d0293e84f85345123e3041/crates/protocol-usb/src/device.rs#L91-L94
would be a single line:
```rust
Some(result) => log::debug!("Reading {:02x?}", result),
```

See https://github.com/knurling-rs/defmt/issues/149 for a similar issue in the `defmt` repository.

Once fixed, we should re-enable the `clippy.uninlined_format_args` lint.

issueDTO.title: Support datamodel validations
issueDTO.description:
As user, one can run

    biber --validate_datamodel xyz.bib

Then, the log is filled with entries such as

    WARN - Datamodel: report entry 'Iron2009' (oliver-kopp.bib): Missing mandatory field 'type'

A pattern for this needs to be added to

    org.jabref.logic.biblog.BibtexLogParser

One can develop test driven, to first add a test to

    org.jabref.logic.biblog.BibtexLogParserTest

## Steps

1. Create a new `@ParameterizedTest` at `BibtexLogParserTest` for error strings and expected `BibWarning`. I assume `@MethodSource` will be needed. Add the above test string and result
2. Adapt `BibtexLogParser`

No need to create a new `.blg` file for testing; this is too much effort.
