issueDTO.title: [Android] Svg swallowing touch events
issueDTO.description:
# Bug

When svg view is placed over other elements, touch events on it behave differently for ios and android. On ios it goes through to the underlying element, which is very useful. On android it doesn't, the touch event ends up in the svg, even though no shape inside it was touched.

It seems like a minor issue but for my use case it is actually absolutely critical.

## Environment info

<!--
  Run `react-native info` in your terminal and copy the results here. Also, include the *precise* version number of this library that you are using in the project
-->

React native info output:

```bash
  React Native Environment Info:
    System:
      OS: macOS 10.14.4
      CPU: (4) x64 Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-8210Y CPU @ 1.60GHz
      Memory: 27.04 MB / 8.00 GB
      Shell: 3.2.57 - /bin/bash
    Binaries:
      Node: 12.2.0 - /usr/local/bin/node
      Yarn: 1.16.0 - /usr/local/bin/yarn
      npm: 6.9.0 - /usr/local/bin/npm
      Watchman: 4.9.0 - /usr/local/bin/watchman
    SDKs:
      iOS SDK:
        Platforms: iOS 12.2, macOS 10.14, tvOS 12.2, watchOS 5.2
    IDEs:
      Android Studio: 3.2 AI-181.5540.7.32.5056338
      Xcode: 10.2.1/10E1001 - /usr/bin/xcodebuild
    npmPackages:
      react: 16.8.3 => 16.8.3 
      react-native: 0.59.3 => 0.59.3
```

Library version: 9.5.1

## Reproducible sample code

<!--
 Please add to your issue a repro, a fresh codebase with the minimal changes so that the bug can be tested in isolation
-->
Here I've made a simple demo: https://snack.expo.io/@eskel/svg-pointer-events
It uses expo version of react-native-svg, but I have the same issue in my app which uses the latest version here.
I've also tried using touch-events='box-none' and it makes no difference at all.

## Steps To Reproduce

<!--
 Issues without reproduction steps or code are likely to stall.
-->

Describe what you expected to happen:
1. Tap the button, it should switch color from blue to green.
That should work consistently on ion and android. Now it only works on ios.
comments:
Hm, ok so this seems like a react native issue. With box-none it works on android, on the other hand it doesn't work on ios, throwing "UIView base class does not support pointerEvent value: box-none".
So I guess the problem is ios now.

For anyone else running into this, here is a workaround (using pointerEvents only on android):
https://snack.expo.io/@eskel/svg-pointerevents-solution
I've the same issue and the workaround didn't worked

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions. You may also mark this issue as a "discussion" and I will leave this open.
Closing this issue after a prolonged period of inactivity. Fell free to reopen this issue, if this still affecting you.

> Hm, ok so this seems like a react native issue. With box-none it works on android, on the other hand it doesn't work on ios, throwing "UIView base class does not support pointerEvent value: box-none".
> So I guess the problem is ios now.
> 
> For anyone else running into this, here is a workaround (using pointerEvents only on android):
> https://snack.expo.io/@eskel/svg-pointerevents-solution

This solution worked for me.
There's wip to support pointerEvents properly https://github.com/react-native-community/react-native-svg/issues/1290 Would you mind testing the latest commit from the develop branch?

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions. You may also mark this issue as a "discussion" and I will leave this open.
Workaround did not work for me
For the workaround, be sure to set the react-native property pointerEvents and not the svg style property pointerEvents.
The workaround did work for me. But it seems like when the parent view of the SVG is scaled the clickable area remains the same size on Android. 😢
It's still there on lastest version 15.12.0. At least are on iOS, on Android it's seem working fine now. relate to #2633 #2639 #2690

issueDTO.title: storage_service/get_natural_endpoints has no way to pass a key containing a colon character
issueDTO.description:
As noted by @KrzaQ:
> How do I use nodetool getendpoints with compound keys? The internet advice seems to be pass the key separated by colon (e.g. nodetool getendpoints mykeyspace superheroes "peter:parker" ), but what do I do if the key itself contains colons?
In my case - audit.audit_log, one of the columns is of type timestamp, so a value could be 2023-12-31 00:00:00.000000+0000 .
I tried following the java code for the tool, but no luck yet.

To enable support at the jmx/nodetool level (or scylla-nodetool), the scylla api needs to support a way to pass key values containing `:`, otherwise they are recognized as composite keys, with the column as key delimiter.

Since the key is passed over an http-based interface I suggest to allow encoding `:` characters using the standard http encoding as `%3A` substrings (`seastar::http::internal::url_decode` can be used to decode such strings).
comments: Although it isn't specified in the RFC (https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3986#section-3.4) many libraries allow passing the same query parameter multiple times, e.g. `somequery?key=3&key=4`. If Seastar doesn't mess this up (e.g., by using a map instead of a list), this can be a way to specify two key components without needing to invent yet another serialization format.

According to https://support.datastax.com/s/article/HOW-TO-Specify-composite-partition-keys-for-SSTable-utilities, the colon is expected to work - although this isn't officially specified in the nodetool getendpoints documentation so I'm note sure we should follow this bad advice:

The reason why this is a bad syntax is that it makes keys like "a:b" ambiguous - is it one component with the ":" character, or two components? It's not an issue of implementation, it's a bug in nodetool syntax that makes this case ambiguous and nodetool has no idea what the user intended.

> Since the key is passed over an http-based interface I suggest to allow encoding `:` characters using the standard http encoding as `%3A` substrings (`seastar::http::internal::url_decode` can be used to decode such strings).

I'm not sure if that was your intention, but such encoding (which obviously has to happen when building the REST API URL), will not help to differentiate whether "a:b" is two components or one with a colon. Also, if the nodetool API is already ambgious (what does the "a:b" the user passed mean?) there is no way that additional encoding can fix it.

If you change anything in this area, please don't forget to add tests.

From the api standpoint what I had in mind is to pass `key=a%3Ab` if the non-composite key (or one of its components) contains `:`.
The user can pass that to nodetool as well.

That said, allowing passing multiple components as request parameters is possible too, though with the current interface it is not intuitive to assume that the multiple key parameters indicate multiple components of a composite key rather than multiple keys, if the API supported returning the natural endpoints for multiple keys.

Note that `%3A` is supported for `keyspace:table` "tuples" when passed as a single parameter or as a comma-separated list of `keyspace:table`, to support keyspace or table names containing `:`.

> From the api standpoint what I had in mind is to pass `key=a%3Ab` if the non-composite key (or one of its components) contains `:`. The user can pass that to nodetool as well.

`key=a%3Ab` is the url-encoded form of setting key to `a:b`. But now that Scylla receives it, how does it know if this was intended to be a string key `a:b` or two components?

Maybe you were thinking of encoding **twice**? If that's the case, the first layer of encoding doesn't need to be URL encoding. Just the outer layer of encoding must be.

Are you sure about what you said about `keyspace:table` allowing real ":"? Last time I checked, I found that at least in one context, you are only allowed to have colons in the table name, not keyspace name (e.g., in Alternator GSI), and what happens is simply that Scylla splits only on the first colon, so `xyz:abc:qwe` means that `xyz` is the keyspace, `abc:qwe` is the table. That's a different thing that what you are hoping to do here.
Can't we use key:"value:has:colons"?

> Can't we use key:"value:has:colons"?

Of course, that's one way to represent it (with taking care of escaping `"` characters within the string if needed).
But we need to be consistent, and the proposal to use %3A to encode column characters is consistent with an http-based REST API.

Introducing a new option for composite keys, e.g. `ckey`, that can be given multiple times to build the key is also an elegant option that is consistent with REST API.

Like @nyh said, we still need to fix the nodetool layer to support composite keys containing `:`.
There, one could use string quoting or even hex encoding to represent binary key values.

> Of course, that's one way to represent it (with taking care of escaping `"` characters within the string if needed). But we need to be consistent, and the proposal to use %3A to encode column characters is consistent with an http-based REST API.

But it won't be "consistent" - you'll need to run the URL encoding **twice**, which is possible, but not something traditionally done in HTTP. So we gain nothing by making the "inner" encoding also another invocation of the URL encoding, it can be something else like quotes or backslashing colons or something. Whatever this inner encoding is, it will need to be documented.
 
> Introducing a new option for composite keys, e.g. `ckey`, that can be given multiple times to build the key is also an elegant option that is consistent with REST API.

Yes, this is similar to what I suggested above, although theoretically you don't even need to change the existing option "key" if you just allow it to be given multiple times - unless giving a key multiple times has another meaning in the API (maybe an OR of several different keys)? @amnonh would know.

> > Of course, that's one way to represent it (with taking care of escaping `"` characters within the string if needed). But we need to be consistent, and the proposal to use %3A to encode column characters is consistent with an http-based REST API.
> 
> But it won't be "consistent" - you'll need to run the URL encoding **twice**, which is possible, but not something traditionally done in HTTP. So we gain nothing by making the "inner" encoding also another invocation of the URL encoding, it can be something else like quotes or backslashing colons or something. Whatever this inner encoding is, it will need to be documented.
> 
> > Introducing a new option for composite keys, e.g. `ckey`, that can be given multiple times to build the key is also an elegant option that is consistent with REST API.
> 
> Yes, this is similar to what I suggested above, although theoretically you don't even need to change the existing option "key" if you just allow it to be given multiple times - unless giving a key multiple times has another meaning in the API (maybe an OR of several different keys)? @amnonh would know.

Currently, it's a singleton, see:
https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/blob/f4bd86384b6ffbcab9af876f83b288bf3e83eab3/api/api-doc/storage_service.json#L565-L568
And we also have this limitation: https://github.com/scylladb/seastar/issues/693

> And we also have this limitation:#693

Wrong link?
Sorry, it's a seastar issue, updated the commnet

Another user just encountered this bug, being unable to use "nodetool getendpoints" with a partition key value that contained the ":"  character. That user, like probably a majority of users, had a single-column (non-compound) partition key. 

We can easily create a fix  for such users: partition_key::from_nodetool_style_string() could check if the schema has a single partition-key component, and if so, avoid the "split on :" logic entirely.

This fix will **not** help in the more general case of compound partition keys (for which an API change is required, as described above), but it would have helped this user, and all other users who have non-compound partition keys.

@amnonh suggested an API improvement for the general case (of compound partition keys, that do need a separator character): 
```
It's also possible to allow the user to override the delimiter (like we do in sed) for this cases
```
Adding this feature to the REST API will be easy, but adding it to nodetool will require a new option.
If my idea above for single-component partition key not splitting at all is _also_ implemented, many users including the ones that noticed this problem will not actually need to use this option.

@bhalevy I've created https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/pull/24720 based on @nyh idea.
I'm not sure it's the right approach, but you can take it from here

> [@bhalevy](https://github.com/bhalevy) I've created [#24720](https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/pull/24720) based on [@nyh](https://github.com/nyh) idea. I'm not sure it's the right approach, but you can take it from here

It's a good start and as @nyh said in https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/issues/16596#issuecomment-2961866634, it doesn't solve all cases, but the common case of a simple, single column partition key.

> [@paszkow](https://github.com/paszkow), [@tarasveretilnyk](https://github.com/tarasveretilnyk) that could be another good issue for ramping up
> 
> Can you please take [a8eaf02](https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/commit/a8eaf0253c7d7456e645bcc656270b59e9cc4230) forward, and add a unit test for it as well?

Regarding "unit" (not really) tests, I think there can/should be two levels of them:

1.  Test in test/rest_api that checks the REST API request in two cases: single-partition-key-column-and-colon-in-the-key and two-partition-key-column-and-colon-used-as-separator. Perhaps we already have a test for the latter case?
2. Test in dtest or test/nodetool (I'm not up to date on what's right) that checks the nodetool command, not rest api. What we change in the REST API **should** translate also to the nodetool command but it's not obvious that it does and should be tested. Some ideas raised in this issue required even more explicit changes to nodetool that would need to be tested.

Please also see my recommendation in https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/pull/24720 to improve the commit message to say exactly what we're fixing and what we aren't, and also consider which documentation we need to update to explain the situation with the colon.

> 
> [@denesb](https://github.com/denesb) should review
We should fix for non-singular keys too, otherwise we are just kicking the can down the road.

> We should fix for non-singular keys too, otherwise we are just kicking the can down the road.

It's unlikely we can fully resolve this for non-singular (composite) keys, especially when text columns are involved. Regardless of the delimiter used, there's always a risk of collision - either with actual characters in the key or encoded sequences such as `%3A`.

As for the alternative of specifying the ckey option multiple times (e.g., --ckey="part1" --ckey="part2"), that approach is also problematic. While nodetool might be able to parse such input reliably, we still need to pass it to our API. This would require merging the parts into a single string, which again reintroduces the possibility of ambiguous delimiters or collisions.

issueDTO.title: Centralise GH Action Secrets for Terraform Module Repos
issueDTO.description:
### User Story

As a Modernisation Platform Engineer,
I want to update the workflows in the MP terraform module repos to use the new centralised secrets management GitHub Action,
So that secrets are managed securely and consistently across all MP-managed repositories.

### Value / Purpose

- Align the MP terraform module workflows with the updated secrets management approach already implemented across other MP repositories.
- Reduce security risk and operational complexity by eliminating reliance on GitHub secrets (where applicable).
- Ensure consistency, maintainability, and compliance in how secrets are handled in CI/CD pipelines.


### Context / Background

This is a continuation of https://github.com/ministryofjustice/modernisation-platform/issues/10126 and https://github.com/ministryofjustice/modernisation-platform/issues/9024 where we have done this for the workflows in the `modernisation-platform` and `modernisation-platform-environments` repositories.

The module repos all use the testing-ci secrets for authenticating with the testing-test account for running terratest. These credentials can now be retrieved using the central github [action](https://github.com/ministryofjustice/modernisation-platform-github-actions/blob/main/.github/workflows/aws-secrets-management.yml)

### Useful Contacts

_No response_

### Additional Information

_No response_

### Definition of Done

- [ ] Update workflows
- [ ] Test
- [ ] Remove GH secrets

1. The overall file tree should be consistent with `vllm_ascend`
2. The file name should be the original file name with a prefix `test_`
3. Use `unittest` framework, make good use of mock

issueDTO.title: Expose memory consumed by query execution on top queries page.
issueDTO.description:
Currently, [vmui](https://play.victoriametrics.com/select/0/vmui/?#/top-queries?topN=30&maxLifetime=30m) displays query duration, interval, and count. However, in some cases, this information alone isn't sufficient to identify heavy queries. It would be beneficial to also display the estimated memory usage per query (`memory_estimated_bytes` field).

For example, the queries `sum(a) + sum(b)` and `sum(a + b)` operate on the same number of samples but consume vastly different amounts of memory???the first is lightweight, while the second is significantly heavier.

By showing memory usage in the UI, such differences would be immediately visible, making it easier to detect and troubleshoot inefficient queries.

While we are on it, can we expose at this plage samples processed by query too ?

issueDTO.title: [Bug]: Docker Image doesn't run on windows 64bit
issueDTO.description:
Hi, in a windows 64bit system with docker isntalled the openlit container can not start. What I did is 
1. clone the repo
2. run docker compose up -d

The container openlit with image ghcr.io/openlit/openlit:latest  does not start and repeades in the log:
exec /app/client/scripts/entrypoint.sh: exec format error

PS E:\openlit> docker --version                                                                                                                                                                            Docker version 28.2.2, build e6534b4
PS E:\openlit> docker compose version
Docker Compose version v2.37.1-desktop.1

Internet ressearch guide that this image is build on anohter architecture than amd64 and by that giving an issue. But not sure how to solve it myself :-/ Any hint please?
comments:
@biohazardxxx Once you clone the repo, could you run teh docker build command and then try running it in your system?

1. Get into the client folder - `cd src/client`
2. Build the docker image - `docker build -t openlit/openlit .`
3. Run the docker image - `docker run -d -p 3000:3000 openlit/openlit`

Correct command for me was:
`docker buildx build -t openlit/openlit .`
the container has this in the log at start:
`exec /app/client/scripts/entrypoint.sh: no such file or directory`

Oh actually could you try

```
cd src && docker compose -f dev-docker-compose.yml up --build -d
```

Same thing unfortunately, openlit container gives :
`exec /app/client/scripts/entrypoint.sh: no such file or directory`

issueDTO.title: EmrStartNotebookExecutionOperator seems to be calling NON-existing waiter
issueDTO.description:
### Apache Airflow Provider(s)

amazon

### Versions of Apache Airflow Providers

apache-airflow-providers-amazon==9.7.0

### Apache Airflow version

2.10.3

### Operating System

-

### Deployment

Amazon (AWS) MWAA

### Deployment details

_No response_

### What happened

airflow.providers.amazon.aws.operators.emr

        if self.wait_for_completion:
            self.hook.get_waiter("notebook_running").wait(
                NotebookExecutionId=notebook_execution_id,
                WaiterConfig=prune_dict(
                    {
                        "Delay": self.waiter_delay,
                        "MaxAttempts": self.waiter_max_attempts,
                    }
                ),
            )

EMR Hook doesn't seem to have waiter "notebook_running"

### What you think should happen instead

_No response_

### How to reproduce

airflow.providers.amazon.aws.operators.emr

        if self.wait_for_completion:
            self.hook.get_waiter("notebook_running").wait(
                NotebookExecutionId=notebook_execution_id,
                WaiterConfig=prune_dict(
                    {
                        "Delay": self.waiter_delay,
                        "MaxAttempts": self.waiter_max_attempts,
                    }
                ),
            )

EMR Hook doesn't seem to have waiter "notebook_running"

### Anything else

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
comments: Thanks for opening your first issue here! Be sure to follow the issue template! If you are willing to raise PR to address this issue please do so, no need to wait for approval.
cc @ellisms can you look into it? This was refactored in #49486

Yes, let me dig into this. 

`notebook_running` definitely exists: https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/a4a51a02db2994e4ea94b83887739dc79a4d11d9/providers/amazon/src/airflow/providers/amazon/aws/waiters/emr.json#L4

@june109109 I noticed the deployment is MWAA. The constraints file used in 2.10.3 specify the Amazon Provider Package is 9.0.0. Are you overriding this to install a later version and have you ensured there are no other package conflicts?

There is a unit test which checks the type of waiter called and it passes for this operator:
`assert_expected_waiter_type(mock_waiter, "notebook_running")`

Is there an error when you run a DAG with this task? I haven't been able to spin up an EMR environment to test an actual DAG yet.

repository.description: Apache Airflow - A platform to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor workflows
repository.name: airflow

summary.main: EMrStartNotebookExecutionOperator seems to be calling NON-existing waiter 'notebook_running'.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The EMR waiter's internal argument path for status should match the actual response from describe_notebook_execution.
summary.attemptedFixes: A custom waiter definition was tried and found out it works well with the case.
summary.otherNotes: The issue occurs because the EMR waiter's internal argument path for status is set to 'notebookexecution.status', but the actual response from describe_notebook_execution uses 'NotebookExecution.Status' (with upper case letter). The waiter may looks for response['notebookexecution']['status'], but actual response is response['NotebookExecution']['Status'], so waits while notebook is finished.

issueDTO.title: Correct behaviour of Copy-Constructors
issueDTO.description:
Follow-Up to #893 

## Description

Copy-Constructors are supposed to create a copy of a given value - by value, not reference.
This is done by constructing a new value for the constructors type by _copying_ all fields from the old value to the one to be constructed.

Throughout the code-base this is currently flawed:
- Some Copy-Constructors miss required fields
- Some Copy-Constructors copy by reference, not value

## Definition of Done

- [ ] Checked for all occurences of Copy-Constructors
- [ ] Adjusted all Copy-Constructors such that **all** _required_ fields (no persistence-ids e.g.) are copied by value
comments:
Hi! I'd like to help with this issue.
I???ve read through the original issue #893 and understand that the goal is to ensure that copy constructors (e.g., in classes like TaskCommentImpl, ObjectReferenceImpl, etc.) copy all relevant fields by value and not reference ??? and omit persistence-related IDs where needed.

Would it be okay if I take on this task? I???ll start by reviewing all *Impl entity classes and correcting the constructors where necessary.

> Would it be okay if I take on this task? I???ll start by reviewing all *Impl entity classes and correcting the constructors where necessary.

Hey Omar! Certainly, go ahead :)
I am looking forward to reviewing your Pull-Request!

repository.description: Lightweight library for general purpose task management
repository.name: kadai

summary.main: The main goal of the issue is to ensure that Copy-Constructors in the code-base correctly copy all relevant fields by value, not reference, and omit persistence-related IDs where needed.
summary.validationOrRequirement: All Copy-Constructors must copy all required fields by value, omitting persistence-related IDs where needed.
summary.attemptedFixes: A contributor has expressed interest in taking on the task and has offered to start by reviewing all *Impl entity classes and correcting the constructors where necessary.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is a follow-up to #893 and has been assigned as a good first issue and improvement.

issueDTO.title: feat: mention others in comments on objects
issueDTO.description:
We recently launched supporting **Comments** on objects in **Langfuse**, see [changelog](https://langfuse.com/changelog/2024-08-20-comments) for context. 

Now, we'd like to enhance the comments feature by allowing users to tag team members and trigger email notifications when tagged. Currently, comments don???t notify anyone. The expected behavior is:

- Users can tag others using @username in comments. The system should validate usernames and notify them via email. The email will include the comment, author, and a link to the trace/observation/prompt/session. 
    - The email should be sent upon submitting a comment. 
    - See [`sendBatchExportSuccessEmail`](https://langfuse.com/changelog/2024-08-20-comments) for an example on how to send emails in our platform  
    - See user data model in [prisma schema](https://github.com/langfuse/langfuse/blob/065992862d232b27dd1735c291fa48da866b0b72/prisma/schema.prisma)
comments:
Hi @marliessophie! I???m interested in working on the feature for mentioning others in comments.

Proposed Plan:
Tagging System: Implement the ability for users to tag team members using @username in comments.
Notification System: Validate usernames and trigger email notifications, including the comment, author, and relevant link.
Email Functionality: Use sendBatchExportSuccessEmail as a reference for sending emails in the platform.
Hi @faresbouzayen, the plan sounds good, would you like to work on this? If yes, is there any more guidance you need?

Hi @marliessophie, here???s what I???m thinking in terms of next steps:

**Tagging System Implementation**
**Parsing Logic:**

Use regex to identify patterns like @username in the comment text.
Extract the username for further validation.
**Username Validation:**

Query the user data model in the Prisma schema to check if the extracted username exists.
Handle cases where the username is invalid or not found.
**Notification System**
**Triggering Notifications:**

Once a valid mention is detected, store the relevant details (comment text, author, and link).
Create a queue or use an event-driven approach to process notifications asynchronously.
**Email Content:**

Format the email body to include:
The original comment text.
The author???s name.
A link to the trace/observation/prompt/session.
**Email Functionality**
Using Existing Email Functionality:

Review sendBatchExportSuccessEmail for structure and parameters.
Create a new function, e.g., sendCommentNotificationEmail, adapting it to our needs.
**Email Sending Logic:**

Ensure proper error handling if the email fails to send.

Hey @faresbouzayen your general direction sounds good!
Some notes: 
- I don't think we need to reinvent the wheel with this feature, I'd first check to see if you can find a a secure, well rated and maintained open source library before jumping to custom implementation (ie applying a regex to recognise the '@' pattern). Possibly these libraries also come with a dynamic dropdown upon typing '@' that will suggest user names in the given person's project. 
- How exactly would you suggest handling invalid usernames? Ideally I'd validate before submitting and then show a form error to the user, such that they don't submit invalid username tags. Suggesting usernames will vastly help here, as mentioned above 
- Also, how would you like to store the details exactly before sending? Feel free to have a browse of our code first, that should help 
- Regarding sending the emails, content sounds great, and in terms of technical infrastructure you should be able to reuse what we already have, ie don't have to build email processing from scratch. Let me know if you have specific questions here! 

Thanks, really excited for your contribution on this!!
Hi @marliessophie, since there hasn't been any activity on this issue for a little while, could I try to tackle this issue?
Absolutely, that would be great!
Hi @marliessophie can I solve the issue, if not yet  solved?
Hi @vipul-69-ax, sure! This is still open:)

summary.main: Implement the ability for users to tag team members using @username in comments, and trigger email notifications when tagged.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Users can tag others using @username in comments. The system should validate usernames and notify them via email. The email will include the comment, author, and a link to the trace/observation/prompt/session.
summary.attemptedFixes: No specific attempts or blockers mentioned in the issue description or comments.
summary.otherNotes: Proposed plan includes implementing tagging system, notification system, and email functionality. It also includes notes from comments about using open source libraries, validating usernames, and storing details before sending emails.

issueDTO.title: Can no longer open snapshots dialog from cli (or as action in file manager)
issueDTO.description:
??????Be aware that his is not a task for beginners or learners.??????
??????You'll need some skills and experience with Python coding.??????

# 👣Your next steps
1. Carefully read the thread. It is old and long.
1. If this is your first contribution in this project please introduce your self and tell us about your skills, wishes and plans. Also let us know how you found the issue and the project.
2. Don't ignore the previous step.
3. Read the existing [contributors documentation](https://github.com/bit-team/backintime/blob/dev/CONTRIBUTING.md).
4. We can develop the next steps in the further discussion. Don't hesitate to ask.

---
# Original posting

I might be missing something here.
Before (when still using backintime-gnome) it was possible to directly opening the snapshot dialog via the CLI or using a custom action from a file-manager, by supplying the path of interest.

Was this option removed in the latest version, or did the syntax change?
comments: You're right. I removed it by accident when I rewrote argument parsing. Will add it back soon :v:

Thanks for the clarification.

(and thanks for this great piece of software)
Classifying this as both a Bug and a Feature Request, because a functionality was accidentally lost and should be newly implemented.

Can someone please explain the lost feature to me. Opening a snapshot dialog via CLI? How have you done this and why is it needed? The CLI has not (or should not have) Qt code in it and therefor is not able to open Qt dialogs.

It has been a while back since I've last used this software/feature so details are a bit hazy (and I seem to have lost my config files).

How i've done it:
Most likely ... from a terminal window (CLI) calling the backintime binary supplying the (absolute) path using some flag.

Why i did it:
Either because it was the easiest solution to open backintime focusing on the correct path.
**Or** (the most likely case knowing me)
The snapshot window is smaller, and thus less intrusive. Which was beneficial when all I wanted was to perform a quick restore (or inspect if restore is even possible).
I mainly used the restore button sub-menu's "Restore to..." functionality (which acted as described in the main window "https://backintime.readthedocs.io/en/latest/mainwindow.html#files-toolbar").

Why was it deemed necessary:
The main use case was to correct for user mistakes. Be it deletion (using ``rm``, so no trash for me) or accidental overwritten the wrong file.
When that happens I usually already was at the filesystem location of interest or could quickly arrive there since most programs allow for "open file explorer at location from last save".
From there on it was a simple CLI call to backintime or a custom action from the file-explorer. Which was easier to do than opening the backintime main window and navigating to the path of interest.

The file-explorer custom action is another benefit of the "call binary and supply path routine". This is something a user can "easily" implement for it's file-explorer of choice without the need for backintime to supply plugins for multiple known file-explorers.

Hope this explanation is of help.
Thanks for explaining. You mean you used `$ backintime foobar` (not `backintime-qt`) and then a GUI window came up?

No problem, after all I did raise the issue :wink:

From a history dive it turned out I was using the following commands (as stored in thunar's `uca.xml`)
```xml
<action>
	<icon>$someArbitraryIcon</icon>
	<name>Previous Versions</name>
	<unique-id>$someUniqueNumber</unique-id>
	<command>/usr/bin/backintime-qt4 -s %f</command>
	<description>Restore previous (file) versions using backintime.</description>
	<patterns>*</patterns>
	<directories/>
	<audio-files/>
	<image-files/>
	<other-files/>
	<text-files/>
	<video-files/>
</action>
<action>
	<icon>$someArbitraryIcon</icon>
	<name>Previous Versions (root)</name>
	<unique-id>$someUniqueNumber</unique-id>
	<command>pkexec '/usr/bin/backintime-qt4' -s %f</command>
	<description>Restore previous (file) versions using backintime (as root).</description>
	<patterns>*</patterns>
	<directories/>
	<audio-files/>
	<image-files/>
	<other-files/>
	<text-files/>
	<video-files/>
</action>
```
Where `%f` inserts the path to the first selected file/directory.
For the `pkexec` command I created a custom polkit rule (in case you were wondering why it was there)

Thanks for the reply.

It is a nice to have feature. But I vote to keep it as it is. The BIT code is not in shape to add something like this. And looking into the age of this Issue, lack of response from other users or not existing similar issues it seems that it is a rare used feature.
Then I'd like to add one "other user response" here. I'd also like to integrate BIT into my file manager's context menu.

OK, the task would be to dive back into the code around the year 2016 and see what Germar removed.
I am open to reviewing pull requests, but currently BIT has more [fundamental issues](https://github.com/bit-team/backintime/blob/dev/CONTRIBUTING.md#strategy-outline) that I want to fix or getting under control. As far as I know, the current team of maintainers does not have the resources to implement such things themselves.

Sorry, guys but this issue still lack of information, especially from Germar. I am not able to solve it that way.

R1dO provided the command used in file managers context menu. It is usig `-s` as a switch. I couldin't find any indication that this switch even existed. I checked the git-history of argparser code and the man pages (see [v1.1.24 man page](https://manpages.debian.org/buster/backintime-common/backintime.1.en.html) for example).

Is this the "snapshot dialog" you referring to?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7d3cb224-cc09-412a-9b89-470da476c979)

I suggest some one of you using a VM and installing an old Debian or Ubuntu, than screen recording (using Peek for example) and show us how the feature really looked like and which BIT version it was. I am a picture-person. 🤣 

Otherwise I need to close the issue without a solution. Sorry.

Ok, I can only speak for myself, and I don't know how the feature worked back then. But for me, it would be completely sufficient if I run `backintime-qt some/directory/with/backups` and then the main window of backintime opens, just with `backintime-qt some/directory/with/backups` preselected (instead of the last used path). Optionally, a snapshot ID could be given, and then the main window opens with that snapshot preselected.
The main goal is, that if I have a file path open in my file explorer, and I'm wondering how the current directory looked like 2 months ago, I don't have to click through the paths in backintime as well.

From my perspective I need some more details. This feature consists of several aspects and that need be considered and planed. This is not only one pull request.

> it would be completely sufficient if I run `backintime-qt some/directory/with/backups` and then the main window of backintime opens, just with `backintime-qt some/directory/with/backups` preselected (instead of the last used path).

What is this path? The destination or the source of the backup?

What does it mean to "preselect a path"? Can you be more specific?

> snapshot ID could be given, and then the main window opens with that snapshot preselected.

That is still implemented.

    $ backintime-qt --profile MYBACKUP
    $ backintime-qt --profile-id MYBACKUP-NUMBER

> The main goal is, that if I have a file path open in my file explorer, and I'm wondering how the current directory looked like 2 months ago, I don't have to click through the paths in backintime as well.

So this is about the backup source?

And "preselect a path" means that the file view (the right part of the main window) has selected this path?

Do I understand this correct?

OK, imagine this scenario: The folder `/home/user/foobar` is included as a backup source in two different profiles. How can BIT decide which profile to open ?

First of all, thank you for still investing time on this old report.

From my part I can try to answer to the best ability of my "hazy" memory. Using quotations from earlier post as to clarify what I am replying too.

> ...
> 
> R1dO provided the command used in file managers context menu. It is usig `-s` as a switch. I couldin't find any indication that this switch even existed. I checked the git-history of argparser code and the man pages (see [v1.1.24 man page](https://manpages.debian.org/buster/backintime-common/backintime.1.en.html) for example).
> ...

This switch might have been an artifact from the time it was still called `backintime-gnome` since that is was my entry point to this app.
The only reference I could find is the following page: https://linux.die.net/man/1/backintime-gnome

> ...
> Is this the "snapshot dialog" you referring to?
> 
> ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7d3cb224-cc09-412a-9b89-470da476c979)
> 
This looks awfully familiar, combined with the information from the earlier link I am pretty sure this is the dialog I grew accustomed to.

The "%f" part of the provided command would then equate to "/home/user/Downloads" as visible in the screenshot.


> ...
> OK, imagine this scenario: The folder `/home/user/foobar` is included as a backup source in two different profiles. How can BIT decide which profile to open ?

This is something I hadn't considered before since it never occurred in my use case. In case you are wondering about 'user' feedback, and based on the "Why was it deemed necessary:" section from my first post on the 9th of June 2024. I would give the following ordered list of preference.

1. Don't care which profile, show timestamps from all profiles and only start worrying about a specific profile once a user selected a specific date/timestamp which to inspect further (or restore).
    * Even if this means 'duplicate' timestamps, although i believe this to be a very rare occurrence given the shown fidelity (image shows seconds).
3. If the caller (script) did not provide a specific profile use the oldest one (first profile?). Or the main one, in case there exist a concept of profiles with different levels of importance.
    * This point outsources the responsibility for selecting the correct profile to the system maintainer. Under the assumption that if a maintainer is 'qualified' enough to specify multiple overlapping profiles it becomes their responsibility to maintain 3rd party scripts/callers (the essence of this functionality).
3. Provide a GUI (or adapt the snapshot one) for selecting the profile to query.

Please note: This is just a *wish* list, without any regards to the difficulties in coding. No expectations arise from this list (at least from my perspective).

Thank you very much for your feedback. That helps a lot. With the man page you linked to I had a specific string I could search the git history for.

```
$ git log -S "show snapshots dialog for the specified path"

commit b2bb84d5b00e2e84a11736cf3ff7d91b57b77f98
Author: Germar <germar.reitze@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Jun 9 21:56:34 2013 +0200

    update help and man pages

commit f19fe9e2121d3123e26b46305b5f8f16a6e5729f
Author: Germar <germar.reitze@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Nov 1 23:06:35 2012 +0100

    store plaintext manpages in bazaar

```
So related commits might be
- b2bb84d5b00e2e84a11736cf3ff7d91b57b77f98
- f19fe9e2121d3123e26b46305b5f8f16a6e5729f

I will take a closer look later.

OK, I had time to think about it. The "Snapshots dialog" will be removed someday and all its features and behavior will somehow be integrated in the main window and its timeline widget.

With this in mind I would formulate the requested feature like this:

- Open a backup profile in GUI by just specifying a path to a directory or folder contained in the backup source (one of the include-list entries).
- If multiple profiles containing this path, a) offer a GUI to select one of the profiles and/or b) select the first/oldest profile. The b) behavior could be customizable in the applications (not profile) settings.

OK, this way?

I am not sure how to realize this in the CLI interface. The current/latest CLI looks like this

```
usage: backintime-qt [-h] [--profile NAME|ID] [--config PATH] [--quiet] [--debug] [-v] [--license] [--diagnostics]
                     {backup,show,restore,remove,prune,unmount,shutdown,check-config,pw-cache} ...

command-line interface (CLI) for Back In Time, to create and manage incremental backups

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --profile, -p NAME|ID
                        select profile by name or id
  --config PATH         read config from PATH (Default: $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/backintime/config)
  --quiet               be quiet and suppress messages on stdout
  --debug               increase verbosity
  -v, --version         show backintime-qt's version number.
  --license             show backintime-qt's license
  --diagnostics         show helpful info (in JSON format) for better support in case of issues

Commands:
  {backup,show,restore,remove,prune,unmount,shutdown,check-config,pw-cache}
    backup              create new backup, if scheduled and not on battery
    show                show information about backups
    restore             restores backup or files or folders from them
    remove              remove a backup
    prune               prune backups based on configured "Remove & Retention" rules
    unmount             unmount the profile
    shutdown            shutdown after backup
    check-config        check full configuration
    pw-cache            control Password Cache

  _              ___       ___
 |_)  _.  _ |     |  ._     | o ._ _   _   Version:
 |_) (_| (_ |<   _|_ | |    | | | | | (/_  1.6.0-dev.0927479b

            Project : https://github.com/bit-team/backintime
        User Manual : https://backintime.readthedocs.io
          Copyright : see file LICENSES.md
    Project License : GPL-2.0-or-later
Additional Licenses : CC0-1.0, GPL-3.0-or-later, MIT
```

Maybe this?
```
  --profile, -p NAME|ID|PATH
                        select profile by name or id
```

I am not totally against it, but I would like to prevent to add a new switch (e.g. `--by-path`).

Following the discussion I see only two users who are interested in this feature. The discussion is quit old. So I wonder if these user still interested and if there is someone else?

Calculating this I think about to leave it as it is and spare the resources for something else.

Any feedback?
I'm still interested in opening BIT with a default path selected. But I think a lot of the discussion was about the specific snapshot dialogue, which I personally don't really care about.

repository.description: A comfortable and well-configurable graphical Frontend for incremental backups, with a command-line version also available. Modified files are transferred, while unchanged files are linked to the new folder using rsync's hard link feature, saving storage space. Restoring is straightforward via file manager, command line or Back In Time itself.

issueDTO.title: Streamable HTTP support
issueDTO.description:
The latest draft specification of MCP states that streamable HTTP will be the supported communication protocol, replacing HTTP + SSE. It would be better if fastmcp provided support for this.

References:

[1] https://modelcontextprotocol.io/specification/2025-03-26/basic/transports#streamable-http
comments:
Hi @hanxuanliang ! Thanks for submitting this.
We are following up close on the new specification, but as the mcp-clients currently only support SSE, we are not adjusting just yet. 
Having said that, we are very open to contribution so if you (or anyone else) would like to pick this up we would be happy to review a PR!
Pinned this issue as it is one of the upcoming things, right after we implement auth support.
Is there any update on this? I'd love to use this in a project. But SSE is a non-starter in kubernetes.
+1 Any update on supporting Streamable HTTP
+1 Any update on supporting Streamable HTTP
+1 Any update on supporting Streamable HTTP
+1 Any update on supporting Streamable HTTP
+1 Any update on supporting Streamable HTTP
+1 Any update on supporting Streamable HTTP
+1 Any update on supporting Streamable HTTP
+1 SSE doesn't work with distributed solutions

Please note that the official Python SDK for MCP supports Streamable HTTP, and it can also integrate with existing FastAPI & Unicorn apps. https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/python-sdk/issues/443

@buremba while it's true that the official Python SDK supports Streamable HTTP and its documentation also reports on how to integrate an MCP server with existing asgi applications (Starlette, FastAPI...), the whole point here is about the capability of the fastapi-mcp library to expose a FastAPI endpoint as an MCP tool, while preserving all FastAPI features, such as dependency injection. This is particularly helpful when it comes to port existing FastAPI applications to MCP. Furthermore, the same dependency injection pattern cannot be replicated with a plain FastMCP server, because it's not part of the SDK, and because the lifespan of FastAPI and FastMCP appications works differently: while the former is bound to the server, the latter is bound to the tool request.
+1 please

+1 Sorely needed.

My FastAPI deployed on AWS ECS can't be turned into an MCP 🥲

summary.main: The main goal is to add streamable HTTP support to fastmcp, making it compatible with existing FastAPI applications and allowing for easier porting of existing FastAPI applications to MCP.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires the fastmcp library to expose a FastAPI endpoint as an MCP tool, preserving all FastAPI features, and supporting dependency injection.
summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned in the comments, but the author is open to contribution and willing to review a PR.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about adding streamable HTTP support to fastmcp, replacing HTTP + SSE, and making it compatible with existing FastAPI applications.

issueDTO.title: Ollama Embedding model name include / can not add success
issueDTO.description: ### Self Checks - [x] This is only for bug report, if you would like to ask a question, please head to [Discussions](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/discussions/categories/general). - [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues), including closed ones. - [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report (????????????????????? [Language Policy](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/1542)). - [x] [FOR CHINESE USERS] ??????????????????????????? Issue?????????????????????????????????:) - [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields. ### Dify version 1.1.1 ### Cloud or Self Hosted Self Hosted (Docker) ### Steps to reproduce hello i use docker deploy dify, the version is 1.1.1. when i add a embedding model (shaw/dmeta-embedding-zh), the dify-api response some error like this request response or error but nomic-embed-text is ok ### ?????? Expected Behavior can add shaw/dmeta-embedding-zh embedding model or other model with '/' ### ??? Actual Behavior _No response_
comments:
<!-- Greeting -->
Hello @duoduo125039! I'm here to help you with any bugs, questions, or contributions related to Dify. Let's get this issue sorted out together!

<!-- Answer -->
I found relevant information regarding the issue with model names containing a '/' character in Dify. When using the Replicate provider, model names must follow the format 'username/model-name' and contain exactly one '/' character. If this format is not followed, the system will raise a `CredentialsValidateFailedError` <sup>[[1]](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/13289)</sup>.

Additionally, there is a similar solved discussion about adding a local Ollama model error. The solution involved upgrading Ollama to the latest version and using the new endpoint `api/embed`, as the old ones have been deprecated <sup>[[2]](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/discussions/7362)</sup>.

It seems like the issue you're facing might be related to the format of the model name or the endpoint being used. Ensure that the model name follows the required format and check if there are any updates or changes needed for the endpoint.


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->
*To continue talking to [Dosu](https://dosu.dev), mention @dosu.*

---
<sup>Help Dosu learn! Give it feedback: [Great Response](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/b0507385-da06-40bc-8b60-5cbce798b4d9?feedback_type=great_response) | [Irrelevant Answer](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/b0507385-da06-40bc-8b60-5cbce798b4d9?feedback_type=irrelevant_answer) | [Incorrect Sources](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/b0507385-da06-40bc-8b60-5cbce798b4d9?feedback_type=incorrect_sources) | [Too Verbose](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/b0507385-da06-40bc-8b60-5cbce798b4d9?feedback_type=too_verbose) | [Hallucination](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/b0507385-da06-40bc-8b60-5cbce798b4d9?feedback_type=hallucination) | [Bug Report](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/b0507385-da06-40bc-8b60-5cbce798b4d9?feedback_type=bug_report) | [Other](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/b0507385-da06-40bc-8b60-5cbce798b4d9?feedback_type=other)</sup>

I can confirm that the name with `/` will raise this error. 

Ollama plugin: 0.0.3
Embedding model: `shaw/dmeta-embedding-zh`

For anyone who is interested in fixing this, please open a PR here https://github.com/langgenius/dify-official-plugins/issues.

Just like @kenwoodjw said, i tested in ollama 0.6.4, i got a `{"error":"unable to load model:...", ...}`

Maybe it's not the problem of the dify/ollama plugin, but rather there seems to be an issue with this model. Its behavior is inconsistent across different Ollama versions (it works in some versions(0.6.2) but not in others)

you can track ollama issue for more details https://github.com/ollama/ollama/issues/9541

and an optional enhance pr for debug log: https://github.com/langgenius/dify-official-plugins/pull/663

summary.attemptedFixes: The solution involves upgrading Ollama to the latest version and using the new endpoint `api/embed`, as the old ones have been deprecated. Also, it seems like the issue might be related to the format of the model name or the endpoint being used.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to the format of the model name or the endpoint being used. Ensure that the model name follows the required format and check if there are any updates or changes needed for the endpoint.

issueDTO.description:
### Self Checks

issueDTO.title: [Feature Request]: Test MCP Server Connectivity Debugging Tool
issueDTO.description:
### 🧭 Epic

**Title:** Test Server Connectivity from Gateway UI  
**Goal:** Help administrators debug server setup issues by interactively sending custom HTTP requests to configured MCP servers  
**Why now:** When adding a new MCP server, it's often unclear if a given URL or endpoint is live, secure, or responding as expected. Today, users must use curl/Postman to debug. This feature allows testing any method, path, headers, or body directly from the Gateway UI.

---

### 🧭 Type of Feature

- [x] New functionality

---

### 🙋????????? User Story 1

**As a:** Gateway administrator  
**I want:** to send custom HTTP requests (GET, POST, etc.) to any path on the server I'm configuring  
**So that:** I can debug connectivity, validate endpoint behavior, and inspect the actual server responses before saving

#### ??? Acceptance Criteria

```gherkin
Scenario: Send a custom request to the server before saving
  Given I am adding a new server in the Gateway UI
  And I enter a server base URL
  When I click "Test Server"
  Then I should be able to:
    - Choose an HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.)
    - Enter a relative path (e.g., /health)
    - Provide optional headers and request body
  When I click "Send"
  Then the system sends the request to base_url + path
  And I should see:
    - HTTP status code
    - Total response time (latency)
    - Response body (pretty-printed JSON if possible)
```

---

### 📐 Design Sketch (optional)

```
+-------------------- Gateway UI ---------------------+
| Server URL: https://api.example.com                |
|                                                    |
| [ Test Server ] ??? opens test panel                 |
+----------------------------------------------------+

??? click

+-------------------- Test Server --------------------+
| Method: [GET ???]                                     |
| Path: /version                                      |
| Headers (JSON): { "Authorization": "Bearer xyz" }  |
| Body (JSON): { "foo": "bar" } (for POST, PUT...)   |
| [ Send ]                                            |
|                                                    |
| ??? Results                                           |
| ??? Status: 200 OK                                    |
| ??? Latency: 120 ms                                   |
| ??? Response:                                         |
| {                                                   |
|   "version": "1.0.0",                               |
|   "status": "healthy"                               |
| }                                                   |
+-----------------------------------------------------+
```

---

### 🔗 MCP Standards Check

- [x] No impact on protocol or server discovery logic
- [x] Safe, diagnostic-only feature
- [x] Follows existing conventions for JSON and HTTP tooling

---

### 🔄 Alternatives Considered

| Option | Pros | Cons |
|--------|------|------|
| Predefined test list (/health, /version) | Simpler UI | Not flexible, less useful for real-world debugging |
| Silent background ping | No UI work | Less control, can miss issues with specific headers/methods |
| CLI-only debug tools | No frontend work | Fragments experience, not user-friendly

---

### 📓 Additional Context

- This is especially useful when:
  - Testing authenticated or proxied servers
  - Verifying custom response structures
  - Diagnosing CORS or TLS errors from browser context
- Future enhancements could include:
  - Copy-as-curl button
  - History of past test requests
  - Auto-fill common headers like `Content-Type: application/json`

issueDTO.title: More than 30 apps, unable to display all
issueDTO.description:
### Self Checks

- [x] This is only for bug report, if you would like to ask a question, please head to [Discussions](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/discussions/categories/general).
- [x] I have searched for existing issues [search for existing issues](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues), including closed ones.
- [x] I confirm that I am using English to submit this report (????????????????????? [Language Policy](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/1542)).
- [x] [FOR CHINESE USERS] ??????????????????????????? Issue?????????????????????????????????:)
- [x] Please do not modify this template :) and fill in all the required fields.

### Dify version

1.5.0

### Cloud or Self Hosted

Self Hosted (Docker)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create over 30 apps locally
2. page router: /apps?category=all 
http://xxxx/console/api/apps?page=1&limit=30&name=&is_created_by_me=false  
response: {
data:[...],has_more: true,limit: 30,page: 1,total: 75
}

### ?????? Expected Behavior

rolling or show pagination

### ??? Actual Behavior

just show 30 apps
comments:
<!-- Answer -->
This is a known UI limitation: Dify's app list uses infinite scroll (not numbered pagination), loading 30 apps per page as you scroll. If you only see 30 apps, the infinite scroll likely isn't triggering because of a fragile layout???usually due to container height, flex, or overflow settings. The IntersectionObserver that loads more apps only fires if its anchor element is scrolled into view, which won't happen if the scrollable container doesn't fill the viewport or if the anchor isn't pushed down by enough content. This pattern is sensitive to CSS and DOM structure changes and has caused similar issues elsewhere in the codebase.

To troubleshoot: check that the main app list container has a fixed or viewport-filling height and `overflow-y-auto`, and that there are enough apps to require scrolling. If needed, try giving the anchor element (the empty div at the end of the list) a visible height or adjusting the container's flex/grow settings. For reference, see the infinite scroll logic in [`Apps.tsx`](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/e17b33e0049c47535c355e7371e99adde074557c/web/app/(commonLayout)/apps/Apps.tsx) and the robust IntersectionObserver setup in [PR #21457](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/pull/21457).

As a temporary workaround, you can fetch all apps directly from the API. Long-term, improving the container/anchor layout or adopting a more robust infinite scroll pattern (like in PR #21457) will help. This is a frontend/UI issue, not a backend/API bug.


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->
*To reply, just mention [@dosu](https://go.dosu.dev/dosubot).*

issueDTO.title: [MCP] ClickSend SMS
issueDTO.description:
## 🧩 Product Overview  

ClickSend is a cloud-based messaging platform for sending SMS, MMS, voice, email, and more. This integration allows automation builders and AI agents to send messages, manage contacts, and monitor communication status across workflows.

---

## ?????? Important Note for Contributors  

To ensure consistency and maintainability, this feature must be submitted as a [Piece](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/piece-definition) following the Activepieces architecture. Submissions that do not follow this format will not be accepted. Please make sure to review the [Piece Development Guidelines](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview) before starting development.

---

## 🚨 Triggers  

| **Trigger** | **Use Case** |
|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **New Incoming SMS** | Start a workflow when a new SMS is received (e.g., customer support, lead inquiry).|

---

## 🛠??? Write Actions  

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case** |
|:--------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| **Send SMS** | Send one or more SMS messages to customers, leads, or internal users. |
| **Send MMS** |  Send event posters or product images.|
|**Create Contact**|Capture webinar registrations into SMS lists.|
|**Update Contact**| Keep contact details current after CRM sync.|
|**Delete Contact**|Opt-out contacts automatically when unsubscribed.|
|**Create Contact List** | Set up segmented marketing lists automatically.|

---

## 🔍 Search Actions  

| **Action Item**               | **Use Case**                                                                                                                                     |
|:------------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Search Contact by Email Address** | Retrieves a contact in a list by email.|
|**Search Contact by Phone**| Retrieves a contact in a list by phone number.|
|**Search Contact Lists**| Check if a marketing list exists before adding contacts.|

---


## 📚 API Reference  
- [Official ClickSend API Documentation](https://developers.clicksend.com/docs#ClickSend-v3-API-SMS)

---

## 🧪 Test Account Access  
Sign up for a free account at [ClickSend Signup](https://dashboard.clicksend.com/#/signup/step0).

---

## 🧑???💻 New to Activepieces?

Activepieces is the leading open source AI automation platform. We have many apps (we call them Pieces), that are available within the builder and as MCPs. These apps are built with our TypeScript framework and are easy to develop. Once merged into our repository, they become available as pieces in our automation builder and as MCPs usable by AI agents and MCP clients.

Start building here: [Piece Development Docs](https://www.activepieces.com/docs/developers/building-pieces/overview)

issueDTO.title: [ACTION] Integrate Pipedream Connect with our Lovable App
issueDTO.description:
Description

We need to integrate Pipedream Connect with our Lovable App to allow users to securely connect and manage third-party services (e.g., Gmail) via managed OAuth.

Requirements:

Implement both Connect Token (popup/iframe) and Connect Link (redirect) authentication flows as per [Pipedream Connect documentation](https://pipedream.com/docs/connect/).

Ensure backend securely generates Connect tokens and handles API calls using the correct Pipedream OAuth client credentials (Client ID, Client Secret, Project ID).

Store connection metadata in our database and handle connection status updates via webhooks.

Provide clear user feedback for successful and failed connections in the UI.

Follow security best practices for environment variable management and error handling.

References:

[Pipedream Connect Overview](https://pipedream.com/docs/connect/)

[Managed Auth Quickstart](https://pipedream.com/docs/connect/managed-auth/quickstart/)

[Example App (Next.js)](https://github.com/PipedreamHQ/pipedream-connect-examples/tree/master/managed-auth-basic-next-app)

Acceptance Criteria:

Users can connect/disconnect their Gmail (and other supported) accounts through the Lovable App UI.

Connection status is accurately reflected and updated in the app.

All secrets and credentials are managed securely.

Errors are logged and surfaced for troubleshooting.

### Implementation Plan for Read-Only Fields Bug

**Todo List:**
- [x] Analyze codebase to understand crud-controller implementation
- [x] Identify form rendering logic for edit operations  
- [x] Examine how readonly property is currently handled
- [x] Create detailed implementation plan with specific steps
- [x] Document required changes and testing approach

---

### **Analysis Complete**

I've analyzed the codebase and identified the issue. The problem is in the `crud_controller.go` file where readonly fields are using the HTML `readonly` attribute instead of the `disabled` attribute.

#### **Current Implementation Issues:**

**All field types are affected:**
- **String fields** (lines 1257-1259, 1240-1242): Uses `readonly` attribute
- **Int fields** (lines 1293-1295): Uses `readonly` attribute  
- **Bool fields** (lines 1322-1324): Uses `readonly` attribute
- **Float fields** (lines 1360-1362): Uses `readonly` attribute
- **Date fields** (lines 1391-1393): Uses `readonly` attribute
- **UUID fields** (lines 1458-1460): Uses `readonly` attribute
- **Timestamp fields** (lines 1481-1483): Uses `readonly` attribute
- **Decimal fields** (lines 1528-1530): Uses `readonly` attribute
- **Select fields** (lines 1617-1619, 1638-1640, 1660-1662): Uses `readonly` attribute

#### **Root Cause:**
The difference between HTML attributes:
- `readonly`: Field is non-editable but still focusable and interactive
- `disabled`: Field is completely non-interactive and truly disabled

Since the crud controller already excludes readonly fields from form processing, the intention is that these fields should be completely disabled from user interaction.

### **Implementation Plan**

#### **Step 1: Update Field Rendering Logic**
**File:** `/home/runner/_work/iota-sdk/iota-sdk/modules/core/presentation/controllers/crud_controller.go`

Replace all occurrences of:
```go
if field.Readonly() {
    builder = builder.Attrs(templ.Attributes{"readonly": true})
}
```

With:
```go
if field.Readonly() {
    builder = builder.Attrs(templ.Attributes{"disabled": true})
}
```

**Lines to update:**
- Line 1241: Textarea readonly handling
- Line 1258: Text input readonly handling  
- Line 1294: Number input readonly handling
- Line 1323: Checkbox readonly handling
- Line 1361: Float input readonly handling
- Line 1392: Date input readonly handling
- Line 1459: UUID input readonly handling
- Line 1482: Timestamp input readonly handling
- Line 1529: Decimal input readonly handling
- Line 1618: Static select readonly handling
- Line 1639: Searchable select readonly handling
- Line 1661: Combobox select readonly handling

#### **Step 2: Test Field Behavior**
- Create test cases to verify readonly fields are properly disabled
- Test form submission to ensure disabled fields don't interfere
- Verify visual appearance meets expectations

#### **Step 3: Consider CSS Styling**
- Ensure disabled fields have appropriate visual styling
- Check that form components handle `disabled` attribute correctly

#### **Step 4: Update Documentation**
- Update any relevant documentation about readonly field behavior
- Consider adding comments about the disabled vs readonly choice

---

**Expected Outcome:**
Fields marked with `readonly: true` will render as `disabled` inputs, making them completely non-interactive while still visible for reference.

### **Summary**

The issue affects **12 specific lines** across all field types in the crud controller. The fix is straightforward: replace `readonly` with `disabled` in the HTML attributes. This change aligns with the expected behavior where readonly fields should be completely non-interactive rather than just non-editable.

The implementation is ready to proceed with the identified changes.

---

  * Remove `ads_conversion_id` class property and it's usage
* [ ] Update `includes/Modules/Analytics_4/AMP_Tag.php`

  * Remove `set_ads_conversion_id` method

### Test Coverage

issueDTO.title: <shift>-<enter> should do an enter but keep user control
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
Sometimes I want to tell gemini cli: 
"""
Look at this output, this is clearly wrong:

  - gic_migration_2024_06_25: ??? Assertion passed: Command succeeded.
  - sakura_repo_exists: ??? Path exists: /Users/ricc/git/sakura
"""

Where the first part (lines 1/2) im typing and the second part (3/4) is the output of some commands i cut pasted.

However, as soon as I press the first eNTER i lose control and gemini cli gets it. We need to have some mechanism to introduce an <ENTER> without ceding focus to the LLM and still be in tyiuping mode.

I suppose SHIFT ENTER is the most natural, but happy to consider others too (or maybe one exists and Im not aware of it)
comments:
I'd support this, and it would be a good first issue for someone interested in contributing.

If no one takes it though then I will.

Heads up, we do support shift-enter on mac if you follow the same steps that Claude asks you to follow to configure your terminal to support it. https://b.corp.google.com/issues/424007249 has more details.
Related: #1699
,take

Just to add, I personally use the Warp Terminal on Mac. By default, Warp allows you to add a new-line using either of the following:

* ??? + ??? Enter
* ??? + ??? Enter

But once you are running Gemini, it doesn't work with either approach.
Thamks for the info on warp. We would really appreciate a pull request to make both of them work  when Gemini Cli is running in warp.

hey @maisyk as per my knowledge warp isnt a terminal on its own, it uses a custom Rust-based UI framework and handles input at the application layer, not via the OS TTY driver

Warp collects keystrokes in its own internal editor, only sending the buffer to the shell on Enter or whatever you configure

so when we use gemini on warp, it is no different than using a gemini on a normal terminal, i hope this helps us understand this issue better

hey @jacob314 i have been trying to create pull requests, but i have been getting this cla error, i tried going through the the entire process mentioned in the initial readme file. i mightve made some error surely but im not able to fix it or anything i dont even know what really is happening
Can you show a screenshot or paste of the error you get?
@ShubhamSachdeva311205 happy to help but like @palladius I can't see the screenshot showing the error you are getting.
@jacob314 @palladius

Looks like one of your commits has your correct email and one has the wrong e-mail. Easiest way to fix this is to use git rebase -i to squash down to 1 commit and then force an upload again. You may want to track down which of your tools was using the wrong email... or no e-mail hence the macbook.local thing.

This needs to be in the docs (new `/help` has keyboard shortcuts in the end) for new line or line break. Leaving a comment here for anyone looking to create a new line:

1. `\ + Enter`
2. `Option + Enter` (only Mac OS)
3. `Ctrl + J`

Upgraded to a new version of gemini-cli and shift+enter stopped working (going to next line)
That still works in claude code though (I'm working out of Windsurf editor atm)
hey @leonk-sportsbet wdym "stopped working" was it working on the older versions ?

summary.main: the issue is about making the `Shift+Enter` work in Gemini cli to introduce an `<ENTER>` without ceding focus to the LLM and still be in typing mode, and finding a solution that works on different platforms
summary.validationOrRequirement: the issue requires a mechanism to introduce an `<ENTER>` without ceding focus to the LLM and still be in typing mode, and the `Shift+Enter` is the most natural solution, but happy to consider others too (or maybe one exists and Im not aware of it)
summary.attemptedFixes: I attempted a code-only fix by teaching the application to listen for a different key combination, `Shift+Down`, which often sends a unique sequence on other terminals. I modified `useKeypress.ts` to listen for the `Shift+Down` sequence (`\x1b[1;2B`) and `InputPrompt.tsx` to handle a `key.shift` flag.
summary.otherNotes: the default macOS Terminal is more limited than anticipated, it appears to strip the `Shift` modifier information from both the `Enter` key and the arrow keys, making a code-only fix for a `Shift+Key` newline combination unfeasible on this specific platform, although i think this might work on other platforms which by default register shift + down as '\x1b[1;2B' but i cant really test it

issueDTO.title: `api-configuration` module name should be adapted
issueDTO.description:
# Feature Request

Currently the `api-configuration` module, that is meant to configure the `identity` api context it is named (and published) `api-configuration`, but it should be renamed to `identity-api-configuration` to keep consistency with other `api-configuration` modules (as `management`, `control` and so on)

## Which Areas Would Be Affected?

_e.g., DPF, CI, build, transfer, etc._

## Why Is the Feature Desired?

_Are there any requirements?_

## Solution Proposal

_If possible, provide a (brief!) solution proposal._

issueDTO.title: Performance: pages under Personalization don't update Header
issueDTO.description:
The four pages under Personalization (Background, Accent color, Mouse pointers, Theme) don't update the NavigationView Header.

Reproduce:

- select Personalization
- open one of these pages (Header is "Personalization")
- go to another page (e.g. Settings)
- use "Back" button (on keyboard or mouse) to navigate back
- Header stays the same as for previous page
comments:
I understand the cause. When you go to settings page and then back to one of these, the header stays with "Settings", so that is surely not right.
Let's add a header text where we can. Should be super easy.

repository.description: Automatically switches between the dark and light theme of Windows 10 and Windows 11
repository.name: Windows-Auto-Night-Mode

summary.main: The pages under Personalization don't update the NavigationView Header when navigating back to them from another page.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The four pages under Personalization (Background, Accent color, Mouse pointers, Theme) don't update the NavigationView Header.
summary.attemptedFixes: Adding a subtree was considered, but rejected. Another possible solution is adding a public Header attribute for NavigationService.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is caused by NavigationView Header depending on NavigationViewItem selected, and these four pages have no Item set. The cause is understood.

Hi @anttipajunen ,
Could you please confirm whether the flows have run successfully in your environment? If they have, the elastic tables typically take up to an hour to populate with the latest Conversation KPI records.

issueDTO.title: Add CLI flag to defer the autopilot loop
issueDTO.description:
### Description

The following scenario came to my mind:
I want to start `renterd` after a shutdown, but I want to change the config first (for instance, to reduce the number of contracts, or to choose other price limits).
However, as soon as `renterd` starts, the contract maintenance will jump in, and I will end up with the whole lot of contracts based on my old config, before I get a chance to change it.
Therefore, I think it would be nice to have a CLI flag that skips the first loop iteration.

### Version

_No response_

### What operating system are you running (e.g. Ubuntu 22.04, macOS, Windows 11)?

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_
comments: Don't you already have a bunch of contracts at that point? Since you had the autopilot running with your old config?

Not necessarily, they might have expired by then.
Although I admit, the scenario I described must be rather uncommon.
In that case I think we can add a flag that not just defers the loop but instead resets the autopilot on startup. Then the loop won't start until you have configured it again.

summary.otherNotes: The issue scenario is uncommon, contracts might have expired, and the author proposes resetting the autopilot on startup instead of deferring the loop.
